Trustwave is a leading cybersecurity and managed security services provider focused on threat detection and response. Offering a comprehensive portfolio of managed security services, consulting and professional services, and data protection technology, Trustwave helps businesses embrace digital transformation securely. For more information about Trustwave, visit https://www.trustwave.com.
$5k and 5 days’ training / continued education allowance per year
Career growth - receive mentoring, coaching, and support to progress your career
Flexible work arrangements and a supportive team (you'll never feel alone!)
Everyone's voice matters here. We aren’t looking for passengers, we’re looking for those interested in an opportunity to develop their skills and experience in information security and make a real difference.
In short, to work here, you need to give a s*** - after all, it could be your data you're protecting.
In return for your commitment, we will develop you personally and professionally in the company of competent colleagues, and you will have a professional development budget at your disposal each year for just that. We also want to recognise and reward your ongoing efforts and have a range of ways of doing that, from an annual bonus, flexible work arrangements, to cake ceremonies (we love cake) or a special night out. But best of all, we’ll give you a hoodie and are happy for you to dress casually when working in the office.
Please note, due to client requirements, it is mandatory you hold a security clearance or be willing / eligible to obtain a BASELINE clearance (this includes being an Australian citizen).
A bit more about the role
Trustwave is seeking a Security Advisor Graduate (GRC / Cyber) who we can train/mentor/coach to provide a broad range of advisory services, covering security strategy, governance, risk, audit and compliance topics, as well as possessing enough of a technical background to be able to confidently work within high-complexity environments.
Your day to day tasks will vary considerably – from helping deliver client projects, working with clients / prospective clients and identifying their security needs and more. Typical delivery tasks might include:
Undertaking security threat and risk assessments
Developing security strategies and roadmaps
Developing and reviewing solution / capability design artefacts
Developing and refining policies, standards, principles and strategies, and assessing their effectiveness
Assisting in the evaluation of emerging technologies, service providers, tools, platforms and applications that are best suited to the specific needs of a given organisation
Delivering security architecture advice (particularly surrounding cloud services)
A bit more about you
You’ll have:
Top-notch written and verbal communication skills
An analytical mindset (particularly when it comes to technology and business risk)
An ability to deliver consulting projects at a high quality, often under pressure, while also developing strong relationships with our customers
Strong passion or interest in cybersecurity or governance/risk/compliance
Education:
Generally though, certifications /qualifications are nice to have. What we care about is what you know, and who you are. How you came to know it – whether via formal education, industry training and certification, self study, or the school of hard knocks -will be a good discussion point, but we don't necessarily favor one over the other.

But most of all, you must be passionate about sharing your information security knowledge with everyone around you, particularly your clients, your colleagues and the broader infosec industry – you want to make a change for the better.
At Trustwave, everyone's experience is valued. We advocate Diversity of Thought, using diversity of experiences and perspectives to innovate and solve real world problems. Our people have studied at different universities, are self-taught, have worked in different companies in Australia, and around the world. Whoever you are, be comfortable, be different, be you, with us. Join Trustwave and together we’ll solve the cybersecurity challenges of today and into the future. About the job:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful.
Who can apply: Prefer Australian Citizen / PR
Required Skills
Minimum of 8 years of experience in Cyber Security operations
Minimum of 2 years of cyber/digital forensic investigative experience?
Minimum of 4 years of?incident response experience?
Minimum of 2 years of experience in Windows desktop, server OS, Linux?
Deep technical knowledge of forensics analysis of Windows and Linux systems (workstations and servers)?
1 professional certification such as: GCFA, CISSP,?EnCE, GCFE, CEH required?
Technology skills with?cyber?security/forensic?software (Encase [preferred], AccessData, etc.)??????????????????
Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook) experience?preferred?

Roles and Responsibilities
Contribute to the execution of Cyber Security incident response and investigations spanning across all functions of the Corporate Security organization.
Conduct cyber security incident response and digital forensic investigations?including remediation and post incident activities as directed by the Cognizant standard processes and procedures.
Perform incident response and end to end investigations on reported cyber security incident categories including but not limited to Malware Incidents, DoS, Data Leakage, Policy Violation and Unauthorized/Malicious access
Conduct incident response analysis on various platform including but not limited to: host-based analysis functions through investigating Windows, Linux, and Mac OS X systems to identify Initial Vector of compromise, and Indicators of Compromise (IOCs).
Rapidly and accurately, determine the source of a security incident and moving quickly to identify and apply containment and remediation steps.
Leverage the corporate incident case management solution to document and report on incidents to meet audit compliance and legal requirements.
Conduct in-depth root cause analysis on complex malware and user/system behaviour events
Independently lead computer incident investigations, determining the cause of the security incident and preserving evidence for potential legal action?
Determine and identify severity and impact and assign appropriate priorities to events and incidents reported
Make recommendations on lesson learned and corrective action for incidents?
Produce security incident and investigation reports/briefings?
Serve as a centralized point of communication during supporting hours and provide appropriate briefings to region heads of DFIR team and other stakeholders as needed.
Gather and analyse forensic evidence for cyber security incidents and investigations wherever required.
Develop and document enhanced incident response processes and procedures.
As a member of the core incident response team, coordinates with Privacy, Compliance Investigations, Corporate Security, and others as warranted
Maintain / contribute to maintenance of Forensics infra.
Salary Range: 130,000 – 150,000 base
Next Steps:
If you feel this opportunity suits you, or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join, we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us.
For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant, visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers
Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.
About Cognizant:
Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Have you studied Mechatronic, Electrical or Information Systems Engineering? Lote Consulting is welcoming graduates from these disciplines.We’re looking for someone with a passion for project management and addressing design challenges in the built environment.Details:Lote Consulting is a leading specialist fire safety and security consultancy. Our mission is making the world safe and secure. As part of our continued growth, we are looking to onboard team players with strong people and technical skills. We are a people-first organisation that deeply values our team and our customers.Your role will be to work as part of the technical team to deliver Crime Risk Assessments, Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design, Security Risk Management, Cybersecurity, Counter Terrorism and Security System Designs, foster better communication and ensure seamless workflows and client outcomes.Key position criteria include:- Tertiary qualification in Mechatronic, Electrical or Information Systems Engineering with a credit average and above;- Well developed communication and report writing skills;- Interest in the crime prevention and security design;- Interest in the risk management process;- An ability to analyse raw data and develop engineering solutions from first principles;The following attributes will be highly regarded:- A postgraduate qualification in security studies, criminology, risk engineering or building services or security;- Practical building services experience;- Experience or qualification in project management;What we offer:Flexible working arrangementsWorking with a high performing, supportive and friendly teamHave a real impact on company growth and successProfessional development and progression opportunities for suitable candidatesLote Consulting has a strong commitment for continual professional development and career progression opportunities for suitable candidates.Residency requirement:Australian citizens onlyApplication procedure: Please submit a CV outlining your qualifications and experience.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, CasualSalary: $50,000.00 – $60,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:New South Wales: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Work Authorisation:Australia (Preferred) Have you studied Mechatronic, Electrical or Information Systems Engineering? Lote Consulting is welcoming graduates from these disciplines.We’re looking for someone with a passion for project management and addressing design challenges in the built environment.Details:Lote Consulting is a leading specialist fire safety and security consultancy. Our mission is making the world safe and secure. As part of our continued growth, we are looking to onboard team players with strong people and technical skills. We are a people-first organisation that deeply values our team and our customers.Your role will be to work as part of the technical team to deliver Crime Risk Assessments, Crime Prevention Through Environmental Design, Security Risk Management, Cybersecurity, Counter Terrorism and Security System Designs, foster better communication and ensure seamless workflows and client outcomes.Key position criteria include:- Tertiary qualification in Mechatronic, Electrical or Information Systems Engineering with a credit average and above;- Well developed communication and report writing skills;- Interest in the crime prevention and security design;- Interest in the risk management process;- An ability to analyse raw data and develop engineering solutions from first principles;The following attributes will be highly regarded:- A postgraduate qualification in security studies, criminology, risk engineering or building services or security;- Practical building services experience;- Experience or qualification in project management;What we offer:Flexible working arrangementsWorking with a high performing, supportive and friendly teamHave a real impact on company growth and successProfessional development and progression opportunities for suitable candidatesLote Consulting has a strong commitment for continual professional development and career progression opportunities for suitable candidates.Residency requirement:Australian citizens onlyApplication procedure: Please submit a CV outlining your qualifications and experience.Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Permanent, CasualSalary: $50,000.00 – $60,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftAbility to commute/relocate:New South Wales: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Work Authorisation:Australia (Preferred) Show more

We are currently seeking an entry-level candidate to join our rapidly expanding Penetration Testing & Cyber Security Team. The role is suitable for candidates who have completed their Certificate 4 in Cyber Security and are looking for their first role or an existing IT professional holding an industry cyber security certification. You will be trained and mentored throughout your journey with the team. If you are highly motivated, love hitting services like hackthebox & tryhackme, bug bounties and CTF’s and looking to move into the security space, this is your role.

Ideally the candidate will be Sydney-based but open to any location as most work is done remotely.

The Junior Penetration Tester / Cyber Security Specialist is part of the security services team which provides high quality security services, such as Penetration Testing, Security Consulting, Security Assessments, Audits, Training, and remediation for Nexon’s new and existing client base. The role will require a broad range of security skills and the ability to exercise excellent judgement, act on priorities, communicate and liaise effectively with clients and co-workers while demonstrating exceptional time and task management. As a Junior Penetration Tester, you will work in all areas of penetration testing and utilise your experience in social engineering, network and web assessments, wireless assessments, reverse engineering, red/blue teaming and so on to have a positive impact on our clients and the company.

Key Responsibilities
Conducting penetration tests on Web Apps, Wired and Wireless networks, Cloud and on-premise environments.
Conduct Social Engineering exercises for our clients, such as Phishing, Vishing, Smishing and physical access testing.
Provide security guidance and consulting as well as a range of security assessments and awareness training to our clients
Completing high quality and tailored reports for all security services provided
Translating business requirements to technical outcomes
Establishing and reviewing internal security policies
Applying and completing relevant Cyber Security Certifications, such as CREST, OSCP, EC-Council etc.
Experience & Knowledge
Certificate 4 in cyber security or completion of a base certification such as CEH or Security+
Broad range of fundamental IT/Networking skills
Be eager to learn and develop in the role and obtain additional industry certifications
Able to obtain and hold relevant police security clearance
Industry certifications such as CREST, CISSP, GPEN, CPENT, EC-Council, OSCP (highly desirable)
Benefits
Competitive salary and benefits
Flexible working arrangements available
Inclusive and fun work culture that rewards high performance
Career development and advancement opportunities
Research time allocated each week/fortnight to hone or learn new skills as well as paid development to improve your skills and obtain certifications
Learn and be mentored from some of the best pentesters in the industry
Attending of various security conferences
Work with like-minded people willing to share their knowledge
Casual and accepting work environment
Opportunity to participate in our generous employee referral program
Successful and stable company with an advanced growth strategy IT & Telecomms

Position Description:
Work for highly performing global IT and Business Consulting firmExpand your knowledge of security through hands-on experience
Accelerate your learning, through exposure to a global multi-tenanted SOC environmentBe exposed to a range of cybersecurity technologies, security events and responsesTraining and certification opportunities to support your career development
Growth role to launch you into other areas of cybersecurity specialisations including developing your cyber consulting skillsParticipate in strong learning environments across a range of IT and OT technologies

Your future duties and responsibilities:
The SOC Analyst is a shift work (24/7 x 365) role with an enticing work/life balanceMonitor and respond to security events utilising run books, investigate incidents, identify false positives and respond accordingly to incidents, raise cases and work with team for resolutions, meeting client SLAsParticipate in strong learning environments across a range of technologies including Splunk, Red Hat, Microsoft, AWS, Azure, and Crowdstrike; to list just a few.Work with Subject Matter Experts for the creation and updating of run booksLearn the use and development of multiple SIEM and the evolution of orchestration and automationParticipate in the monthly reporting creation and delivery

Skills and experience required to be successful in this role:

A passion for cybersecurityStudies in CybersecurityAbility to succeed and support others in a high pressure but rewarding environmentExcellent communications skills (Verbal and written)
Demonstrated analytical thinking for problem solvingFull work rights for Australia.
Skills:
Security
What you can expect from us:
Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.


When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Company Description
We are SGS – the world’s leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 96,000 employees operate a network of 2,700 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world.

Job Description

Be able to effectively plan, conduct and lead audits across a wide range of industry sector codes.
Lead assessment / audit teams, as required, ensuring that team members are adequately briefed so that audit / assessment outcomes are achieved and quality of service is maintained and that effective working relationships are sustained both with Clients and within the team.
Collate audit / assessment findings, prepare reports and communicate findings to clients to ensure understanding of the requirements and area(s) that need to be addressed and/or corrective action required.
Provide accurate and prompt information to the Delivery Support Team, working closely with them to ensure that client records are up to date and complete and that all other internal information requirements are met.
 Plan and schedule your audit / assessment workload to make best utilisation of your own time and maximise revenue-earning activity, performing the duties described above, to ensure that such duties are performed in an efficient and commercially expedient way
Maintain and continue to develop audit assessment skills, technical knowledge and participate in ensuring that any Continued Professional Development (CPD) requirements are met.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent University level education and experience.
IRCA Lead Auditor ISO/IEC 27001
Have knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements applicable to the products or services being audited
More than 4 years full time experience in an IT related role
At least 2 years in a role or function relating to information security
Current, valid driver’s license
Holding one of following Information Security or Auditor qualifications:
CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
CISM (Certified Information Security Manager)
 CISA (Certified Information System Auditor)
 Other relevant professional qualification directly related with information security
Additional Information
WHY WORK FOR SGS?
Working at SGS means joining an innovative, global Company. Let’s break down what that means for you.
As a Company, we have embraced the shift to flexible work. We encourage our employees, wherever operationally possible, to work in arrangements that support a work-life balance.
We’re a Company who believe our impact on society is important, so Sustainability is embedded in our culture and the way we do business.
Paid Parental leave scheme for 8 weeks for eligible employees.
We are driven to ensure we have a positive impact on our local communities through paid employee volunteering days and regularly encouraging time off to donate blood.
Health & Wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer annual health club membership rebates and discounted private health insurance, as well as a supportive Employee Assistance Program.
Ongoing learning & development is vital to the success of any Company. We believe in investing in our employees, so we offer education assistance programs and encourage the use of our online learning platform.
Career Development Opportunities (nationally and Globally)
COME TO WORK AND BE 100% YOU
SGS Australia supports a diverse workforce and we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability. Providing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is an important part of our SGS Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP). We truly believe the diversity among us will continue to foster a strong, innovative and forward-thinking workplace.
SGS Australia acknowledges and pays respect to the past, present and future Traditional Custodians and Elders of this nation and the continuation of cultural, spiritual, and educational practices of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

At least 2 years in a role or function relating to information security
Current, valid driver’s license
Holding one of following Information Security or Auditor qualifications:
CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
CISM (Certified Information Security Manager)
 CISA (Certified Information System Auditor)
 Other relevant professional qualification directly related with information security
Additional Information
WHY WORK FOR SGS?
Working at SGS means joining an innovative, global Company. Let’s break down what that means for you.
As a Company, we have embraced the shift to flexible work. We encourage our employees, wherever operationally possible, to work in arrangements that support a work-life balance.
We’re a Company who believe our impact on society is important, so Sustainability is embedded in our culture and the way we do business.
Paid Parental leave scheme for 8 weeks for eligible employees.
We are driven to ensure we have a positive impact on our local communities through paid employee volunteering days and regularly encouraging time off to donate blood.
Health & Wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer annual health club membership rebates and discounted private health insurance, as well as a supportive Employee Assistance Program.
Ongoing learning & development is vital to the success of any Company. We believe in investing in our employees, so we offer education assistance programs and encourage the use of our online learning platform.
Career Development Opportunities (nationally and Globally)
COME TO WORK AND BE 100% YOU
SGS Australia supports a diverse workforce and we encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability. Providing employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people is an important part of our SGS Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP). We truly believe the diversity among us will continue to foster a strong, innovative and forward-thinking workplace.
SGS Australia acknowledges and pays respect to the past, present and future Traditional Custodians and Elders of this nation and the continuation of cultural, spiritual, and educational practices of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.

We are SGS – the world’s leading testing, inspection and certification company. We are recognized as the global benchmark for quality and integrity. Our 96,000 employees operate a network of 2,700 offices and laboratories, working together to enable a better, safer and more interconnected world. Job Description

Be able to effectively plan, conduct and lead audits across a wide range of industry sector codes.
Lead assessment / audit teams, as required, ensuring that team members are adequately briefed so that audit / assessment outcomes are achieved and quality of service is maintained and that effective working relationships are sustained both with Clients and within the team.
Collate audit / assessment findings, prepare reports and communicate findings to clients to ensure understanding of the requirements and area(s) that need to be addressed and/or corrective action required.
Provide accurate and prompt information to the Delivery Support Team, working closely with them to ensure that client records are up to date and complete and that all other internal information requirements are met.
 Plan and schedule your audit / assessment workload to make best utilisation of your own time and maximise revenue-earning activity, performing the duties described above, to ensure that such duties are performed in an efficient and commercially expedient way
Maintain and continue to develop audit assessment skills, technical knowledge and participate in ensuring that any Continued Professional Development (CPD) requirements are met. Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent University level education and experience.
IRCA Lead Auditor ISO/IEC 27001
Have knowledge of legal and regulatory requirements applicable to the products or services being audited
More than 4 years full time experience in an IT related role
At least 2 years in a role or function relating to information security
Current, valid driver’s license
Holding one of following Information Security or Auditor qualifications:
CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
CISM (Certified Information Security Manager)
 CISA (Certified Information System Auditor)
 Other relevant professional qualification directly related with information security

Job Description
Location: Melbourne | Eastern Metropolitan
Job type: Full time / Ongoing
Organisation: Country Fire Authority
Salary: Salary not specified
Occupation: IT and Telecommunications
Reference: VG/1654209
Located at CFA Headquarters, Burwood East


Full time, ongoing


PTA 7 $142,676 (plus 10.5% superannuation)

The Country Fire Authority (CFA) is one of the world's largest, and most highly regarded, community-based emergency services organisations. We are proud of the work we do in protecting lives and property, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. CFA strives to be a values-based organisation and an organisation of choice for volunteers and employees, where people with a variety of skills, experiences and backgrounds all add value through the roles they perform.

About the Role:

This is a newly created position reporting to the Chief Information officer and will be a key addition to the ICT leadership team that has stakeholders across CFA and partner organisations.

The Cyber Security Manager will be responsible for identifying, mitigating, and managing risk to CFA infrastructure and system against cybersecurity incidents and well as identifying, analysing, communicating and containing these incidents when they occur.

About You:

You will be a strong leader and manager with experience in Cyber Security management and able to influence and foster a productive work environment for your team. You will be able to draw upon your knowledge an experience in setting strategic direction and business planning for ICT and Cyber security. Qualified with professional security management certification (e.g., CISM) you will also be well versed in the regulatory, legislative frameworks and broader industry practices and be able to adapt these to the assessment and mitigation of risk at CFA.

Your application:

When applying for a position with CFA, the key to progressing in the selection process is the quality of your application. Your application must demonstrate that you have the qualifications, experience, key attributes, and skills required for the position.

Your application should include:

Cover letter
Resume

Submitting your application:

When you click the 'apply' button you will be taken to the online application form. Here you will be asked to provide personal and contact details and respond to employment-related questions.

Pre-employment checks:

Offers of employment will only be made to candidates who:

Can provide acceptable evidence that they meet full vaccination status (includes booster dose).
Successfully complete a National Police History Check and Working with Children Check

CFA is committed to creating and maintaining a diverse, inclusive, and safe volunteer and work environment. Our aim is to have a volunteer and paid workforce that reflects the community it serves. First Nations people, women, people of all ages, with disabilities and culturally and linguistically diverse people are encouraged to apply.

Provide technical support of BAU operations for Australian Unity’s people and processes.
12 month fixed-term contract role – excellent salary package and benefits on offer.
We’re for real wellbeing.

What makes us, us

Established in 1840, we’re Australia’s first member-owned wellbeing company, delivering health, wealth and care services to more than 700,000 Australians. Today, while we’ve grown to a company of more than 7000 employees, our focus remains the same as it was 180 years ago — to deliver Real Wellbeing for our customers, members and the community.

We support your Real Wellbeing so you can better support our members’ and customers’ wellbeing journey

There are four key attributes that set us apart:

Good people: We strive to set ourselves apart through the capability, warmth and expertise of our people.
Wellbeing experts: Our breadth of capability enables us to provide smart solutions and services across all domains of wellbeing.
Long-term commitment: As a member-owned company, we’ve been focusing on long-term outcomes and single-minded dedication to our members and customers since 1840.
Driving positive impact: Everything we do is focused on making a positive difference at a personal, community and societal level.

These pillars are infused with our values of bold, warm and honest

Our Opportunity
Reporting to the Cyber Security Manager (Identity and Access Management), you will provide technical support of BAU operations for the Identity and Access Management (IAM) platform in the Cyber Security team. This includes day to day support activities such as health checks and incident resolution, answering and troubleshooting user queries, onboarding applications to the IAM solution and supporting IAM uplift initiatives. This role will have a predominately technology focus, maintaining the day-to-day BAU running of the IAM services.
What you will do
Support and maintain the enterprise IAM solution (SailPoint IdentityIQ)
Configure and build new integrations in the enterprise IAM platform with different applications using the established integration patterns
Maintain the IAM solution and services – work with the broader Cyber Security team to continuously improve the solution and services
Support IAM solution testing activities
Collaborate with and support various technical and business stakeholders to document and understand onboarding requirements for each part of the business
Contribute to the building of the IAM onboarding service, including designing operational processes, developing collateral and defining onboarding patterns

What we are looking for
Minimum 2 years of experience in a BAU developer or technology support role, ideally within a large and complex organisational environment
Experience in Java or an equivalent programming language and SQL Technologies
Ability to pick up new technologies and platforms
Relevant tertiary qualifications
The ability to work independently and prioritise work to manage conflicting deadlines
Excellent stakeholder management and the ability to develop effective working relationships
Knowledge of security principles, practice and standards is preferred
Previous Cyber / Information Security analysis experience with exposure to Identity and Access Management (IAM) is preferred
Previous SailPoint IdentityIQ experience is preferred

Our Benefits

You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including:

Competitive Remuneration and variable bonus
A range of attractive product and service discounts from Australian Unity’s Retail and Wealth Management portfolio – including health insurance and banking products
Flexible Working Arrangements including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life balance
Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform
Additional paid Wellbeing and Volunteer leave days yearly

Where to from here?

Please contact Henry Reyes, Talent Acquisition Specialist, for a confidential discussion or more details – hreyes@australianunity.com.au.
Please note that all Australian Unity employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID 19. Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people. Today, while we’ve grown to a company of more than 7000 employees, our focus remains the same as it was 180 years ago — to deliver Real Wellbeing for our customers, members and the community.

We support your Real Wellbeing so you can better support our members’ and customers’ wellbeing journey

There are four key attributes that set us apart:

Good people: We strive to set ourselves apart through the capability, warmth and expertise of our people.
Wellbeing experts: Our breadth of capability enables us to provide smart solutions and services across all domains of wellbeing.
Long-term commitment: As a member-owned company, we’ve been focusing on long-term outcomes and single-minded dedication to our members and customers since 1840.
Driving positive impact: Everything we do is focused on making a positive difference at a personal, community and societal level.

These pillars are infused with our values of bold, warm and honest

Our Opportunity
Reporting to the Cyber Security Manager (Identity and Access Management), you will provide technical support of BAU operations for the Identity and Access Management (IAM) platform in the Cyber Security team. This includes day to day support activities such as health checks and incident resolution, answering and troubleshooting user queries, onboarding applications to the IAM solution and supporting IAM uplift initiatives. This role will have a predominately technology focus, maintaining the day-to-day BAU running of the IAM services.
What you will do
Support and maintain the enterprise IAM solution (SailPoint IdentityIQ)
Configure and build new integrations in the enterprise IAM platform with different applications using the established integration patterns
Maintain the IAM solution and services – work with the broader Cyber Security team to continuously improve the solution and services
Support IAM solution testing activities
Collaborate with and support various technical and business stakeholders to document and understand onboarding requirements for each part of the business
Contribute to the building of the IAM onboarding service, including designing operational processes, developing collateral and defining onboarding patterns

What we are looking for
Minimum 2 years of experience in a BAU developer or technology support role, ideally within a large and complex organisational environment
Experience in Java or an equivalent programming language and SQL Technologies
Ability to pick up new technologies and platforms
Relevant tertiary qualifications
The ability to work independently and prioritise work to manage conflicting deadlines
Excellent stakeholder management and the ability to develop effective working relationships
Knowledge of security principles, practice and standards is preferred
Previous Cyber / Information Security analysis experience with exposure to Identity and Access Management (IAM) is preferred
Previous SailPoint IdentityIQ experience is preferred

Our Benefits

You will enjoy a range of great employee benefits and rewards including:

Competitive Remuneration and variable bonus
A range of attractive product and service discounts from Australian Unity’s Retail and Wealth Management portfolio – including health insurance and banking products
Flexible Working Arrangements including Work-From-Home days with a real work-life balance
Available access to LinkedIn Learning courses through our great Learning platform
Additional paid Wellbeing and Volunteer leave days yearly

Where to from here?

Please contact Henry Reyes, Talent Acquisition Specialist, for a confidential discussion or more details – hreyes@australianunity.com.au.
Please note that all Australian Unity employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID 19. Australian Unity is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we encourage applications from all members of the community, including people of Aboriginal and Torres strait Islander descent, culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds and, mature aged people. Show more

companyName: AIHW Australian Institute of Health & Welfare
listing_jobDesc:
Position: IT Security Officer
Classification: APS Level 6
Location: Canberra ACT
Job Reference: 100_08/22
Group: Information and Communication Technology Group
Unit: IT Security Unit
Salary $87,869 – $97,137 plus superannuation
Engagement Type: Ongoing, full-time, part-time
Advertised: Commonwealth Gazette Thursday 18 August 2022
Closing Date: 11:30pm, Thursday 1 September 2022
Contact Officer: Simon Hilton, simon.hilton@aihw.gov.au, 02 6249 4729
More information: Visit our careers page on the AIHW website
This recruitment exercise may be used to fill similar positions in the Information and Communication Technology
Group or within the Institute over the coming 18 months.
About the AIHW
The Australian Institute of Health and Welfare (AIHW) provides reliable, regular and relevant information and
statistics on Australia’s health and welfare.
We are committed to providing high quality, national data and analysis across the health, housing and
community services sectors. This covers a wide range of areas, from health and welfare expenditure,
hospitals, disease and injury, disability and mental health, to ageing, disadvantaged and vulnerable
populations, homelessness, and Indigenous health and welfare.
The AIHW Difference
We value an inclusive, flexible and productive workplace where people are treated with respect and courtesy,
and diverse and unique attributes are recognised and valued. We offer our staff a range of benefits
including:
access to modern, mobile technology and tools to enable flexible working
attractive remuneration packages including generous superannuation and leave provisions
challenging and fulfilling work where individuals can use their skills and expertise
opportunities for professional development including study assistance
Our strong culture of collaboration and commitment to excellence is consistently demonstrated in the
annual APS Employee Census with top ten rankings in both staff engagement and wellbeing scales out of 101
APS agencies.
The AIHW is committed to creating genuine opportunities for all and welcomes applications from Aboriginal
and Torres Strait Islander people(s), people with disability, LGBTIQA+, neurodiverse people and people from
diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds.
The AIHW has offices in Canberra and Sydney and supports flexible working arrangements including remote
work for many roles.
For more information, visit the Benefits of working for the AIHW page of our website.
Position Summary
The ICT Group is the responsible for strategic ICT capability and the delivery of ICT services at the AIHW. The
IT Security unit ensures that our ICT services enable the AIHW to securely execute its mission. It has a broad
security remit covering all elements of the ACSC cyber security principles (Govern, Protect, Detect and
Respond). We manage IT security risk, ensure required security controls are implemented and effective and
monitor for security alerts and vulnerabilities.
The IT Security Unit is looking for an IT Security Officer who will work in a small team under general direction.
Primary duties for the role focus on the Govern and Protect principles and include:
performing and/or facilitating security assessments, security audits and other reviews.
undertaking risk assessments and other risk management activities.
IT security policy development, implementation, and managements.
working with project teams and solution architects to ensure security requirements are built into new
projects and support the development of practical security documentation.
Secondary duties are to support the other functions of the team and include:
contributing to an on-going cyber security awareness program.
working with the broader ICT Group to continuously improve security controls in line with the
essential 8, the Information Security Manual (ISM) and cyber security best practice.
performing general security operations, including alert monitoring, vulnerability management and
investigating security incidents.
Selection Criteria
Our ideal candidate will be customer focused and have most or all of the following skills and knowledge:
1. Current experience working in a cyber security role or in-depth knowledge of another IT field (e.g.
networking, servers) with demonstrated understanding of core cyber security principles.
2. Demonstrated knowledge of the ISM or other cyber security frameworks.
3. Ability to apply a principles-based approach to solving unique and complex problems.
4. Understanding of core technologies used in a typical hybrid enterprise environment (e.g. Microsoft
products, network devices, firewalls, cloud services and other security appliances).
5. Good communication skills including the ability to communicate with a range of internal and external
stakeholders.
6. Experience with Tenable, M365 and Microsoft Azure security tools is highly desirable.
Relevant qualifications in cyber security will be highly regarded but are not required.
How to Apply
Please submit your application online via the AIHW e-Recruit system. When applying online for the first time,
you will need to register and provide a valid email address.
Please provide:
1. A summary of your relevant skills and experience and explain why you would be the best person for
the role. Your response should align with the position summary and/or selection criteria information
above and must be no more than 750 words.
2. Your current CV and the names of two referees.
Reasonable Adjustment
The AIHW is committed to providing accessible, inclusive and equitable recruitment processes for all
candidates. If you require a reasonable adjustment (at any stage of the recruitment process), you can note
this in your application and provide details of any adjustments required. All efforts will be made to meet your
requirements.
Reasonable adjustments may include but are not limited to additional interview time, being interviewed at a
particular time of day, interview material printed in large font, making allowances for varying communication
styles.
RecruitAbility
The AIHW is committed to supporting the employment and career development of people with
disability. Our participation in APS RecruitAbility means we will progress an applicant who declares that they
have disability to a further stage in the recruitment process, where they opt into RecruitAbility on the
application form and meet the minimum requirements for the role. Position: IT Security Officer
Classification: APS Level 6
Location: Canberra ACT

Group: Information and Communication Technology Group

job_title: Experienced Cyber Professionals (Multiple roles for Perth)
listing_jobDesc:
Date: 17-Aug-2022

Location:
Perth, WA, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 27369


Flexible work arrangements across Perth – work in a way that suits your life
Pathway to Partnership – receive support and mentoring to progress your career
Working Visa sponsorship
Relocation packages will be considered

Would you like to call Perth home?

We are calling on Cyber Professionals across a range of levels wanting to move to Perth (Western Australia).

You will bring a strong balance of technical experience, communication, and interpersonal skills, which will enable you to engage at all levels of an organisation around the cyber risk agenda. A wide range of security advisory services, such as cyber security strategy, threat and risk assessments, security design, and transformation. You will work within a diverse team who are passionate about helping organisations to assess, define and sustainably implement cyber security capability.

We are currently hiring for various roles from Consultant through to Director level across Cyber Security, Strategy and Analytics. We are open to considering candidates from a variety of Cyber backgrounds and we have internal programs and pathways to guide your career path.

Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

Enough about us, let us talk about you.

You are someone with:

Proven experience in a cyber security or advisory role
Experience in performing security threat and risk assessments and delivering projects relating to security strategy, governance, security architecture and capability improvement
Background in strategy/framework/assessment/TPRM would be beneficial

Job Description
Location: Melbourne | CBD
Job type: Full time / Fixed-term until 01-MAY-2024
Organisation: Museum Victoria
Salary: $103,920 - $114,828
Occupation: IT and Telecommunications
Reference: VG/MV/9546B
Australia’s largest public museum organisation is seeking a Cyber Security Operations Analyst.
Cyber Security Operations Analyst

Are you:

Expert in intrusion detection systems, SEIM, Anti-Malware, email gateway, Azure security and data loss prevention?
Able to develop and apply effective cyber security standards, processes technology and solutions in a team environment?
Keen to contribute to a measurable uplift in cyber security for a major cultural organisation?

Australia's largest public museum organisation is seeking a Cyber Security Operations Analyst.

ABOUT MUSEUMS VICTORIA:

Museums Victoria cares for the State scientific and cultural collections, providing visitor access, activities and events at five distinct venues: Melbourne Museum, Immigration Museum, Scienceworks, IMAX Cinema and world heritage listed Royal Exhibition Building.

To learn more about Museums Victoria, please visit museumvictoria.com.au/about/

ABOUT THE POSITION:

The primary responsibility of the Cyber Security Operations Analyst is the configuration, tuning and operation of enterprise security management tools to detect and respond to cyber security related incidents proactively. In addition, this position will focus on delivering security detection, monitoring and prevention capabilities for both physical and virtual infrastructures as well as perform security related troubleshooting and management of ICT infrastructure.

Notable skills and experiences:

Implement the recommendations of a cyber security audit by working with colleagues to deploy and configure tools and contribute to the development of standards and processes to improve and maintain a cyber security posture for Museums Victoria.
Configure, tune, and operate enterprise security management tools to detect and respond to cyber security related incidents proactively.
Perform security related trouble shooting and management of ICT infrastructure, including networks, often in circumstances whereby trouble shooting decisions may have a significant impact on MV's ICT infrastructure.

The successful applicant will have:

Solid technical knowledge, experience and understanding of current security concepts, principles, and practices preferably in the Australian/Victorian government. Broad knowledge of technical concepts with a focus on security.
Strong hands-on experience and knowledge with intrusion detection systems, SEIM, Anti-Malware, email gateway, Azure security, data loss prevention, and related enterprise security management tools.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in developing and applying effective cybersecurity standards, processes, technology, and solutions. Demonstrated ability to work flexibly, both proactively and reactively, to address security challenges and issues.


OTHER INFORMATION

This is a VPS5.1, full time position for two years. The salary on offer is $103,920 (base of grade)+ 10.5% superannuation.

HOW TO APPLY?

To view the position description, visit Careers - Museums Victoria; for more information about this position, please contact Sam Serhan on 03 9385 4285.

To apply, please send your Covering Letter, Resume, a statement addressing each of the Key Selection Criteria by visiting Careers - Museums Victoria

About the Team: The Critical Infrastructure and Operational Technology Environments (CIOTE) section in the Cyber Uplift Branch, ACSC is responsible for enhancing cyber security resilience for critical infrastructure, with a focus on operational technology, and government around Australia. The ACSC achieves this through initiatives like the Critical Infrastructure Uplift Program (CI-UP) a key initiative of CIOTE. CI-UP provides organisations with a holistic evaluation of their current cyber security maturity, along with tailored advice and assistance to identify and remediate security vulnerabilities.About the Role: As a cyber security specialist, you will be provided with a unique opportunity to undertake challenging and rewarding work that contributes to maintaining Australia’s national security. As a cyber security specialist - defensive technologist, you will help contribute to building Australia’s cyber security resilience by protecting critical assets and information.To achieve our mission, we want people with strong integrity, agility, curiosity, imagination, resilience and creativity. These abilities are needed to out-think and out-imagine some of the most testing adversaries and problems imaginable. Cyber security specialists work in high-paced operational environments that require creative problem solving by self-starters and the ability to collaborate with others. We are looking for applicants who can think critically and have the aptitude to come up with innovative solutions. We encourage applications from anyone who is motivated to develop their skills and can adapt to the rapid pace of technology advancement.Desirable Qualifications, Experience or TrainingOur cyber security specialists have a mix of specialist skills and abilities. Candidates with experience or qualifications in any of the skills, disciplines or platforms listed below are encouraged to apply.Cloud security design and implementationCyber and information securityNetwork design and implementationPenetration testingProgramming/scripting/software developmentCyber Security assessments and auditingCyber Security program managementSystems administrationSystems and software designThreat intelligence and modellingWeb-based platformsCyber security architectureEligibility: Please ensure that you meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Information Pack prior to submitting an application.Citizenship - To be eligible for employment with ASD, applicants must be an Australian citizen.Health Assessment - The preferred applicant may be required to undergo a medical examination conducted by the Agency’s preferred medical provider.Organisational Assessment – To be eligible for employment within ASD, the preferred applicant will be required to undergo an Organisational Assessment (see Organisational Assessment section in the Information Pack).Security Clearance - The preferred applicant will be required to successfully undergo the security clearance vetting process at a specified clearance level. The preferred applicantMUST be willing to disclose all relevant and required information.Application Closing Date: Sunday, 14 August 2022For further information please review the job information pack, reference ASD/04126/22 on https://www.asd.gov.au/careersJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $69,811.00 – $119,651.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to Friday About the Team: The Critical Infrastructure and Operational Technology Environments (CIOTE) section in the Cyber Uplift Branch, ACSC is responsible for enhancing cyber security resilience for critical infrastructure, with a focus on operational technology, and government around Australia. The ACSC achieves this through initiatives like the Critical Infrastructure Uplift Program (CI-UP) a key initiative of CIOTE. When you join Verizon
Verizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We're a diverse network of people driven by our shared ambition to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward - and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.
What you’ll be doing...
Verizon is a Fortune 500 company and takes pride in servicing 99% of Fortune 500 companies as well as Government Agencies around the world. In Canberra, we run two key business units - the Government Security Operations Centre (GSOC) and Advanced Security Operations Centre (ASOC), providing services to customers who rely on Verizon to provide twenty four seven security analytics of their critical infrastructure.
A key part of our ASOC capability comes from our Tier 1 Analysts, people with a keen eye for detail, analytical thinking, and a willingness to learn cyber security tradecraft. Candidates will come from a background in technology. You will be taught on the job how to handle common recurring security, monitoring and other incidents on a SIEM platform. This is a great entry level role to kick start your career in Cyber Security.
Monitoring, Alert Triage, Analysis, and Incident Determination - managing incidents through lifecycle on the SIEM & service management platforms.
Working on customer incidents to completion independently and within service level agreements.
Coordinating with Senior Analysts and customer personnel for high priority incidents.
Continual service improvement and assisting in detection development.
Where you’ll be working...
This hybrid role will have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days as set by the manager.
What we’re looking for...
You’ll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree or oneor moreyears of work experience.
One year of cyber security experience.
Experience in Linux, Windows, SIEM platforms, Scripting, TCP/IP, DNS and/or network and log analysis.
A current NV1 security clearance, or the willingness to obtain and maintain a security clearance.
Even better if you have one or more of the following:
ITIL Foundations experience or other relveant cyber security certifications.
Strong communication skills.
Two years of experience in a technical role.
Ability to engage with customers to understand their requirements.
Diversity & Inclusion
We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.
COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement
Please note, in countries where there is a COVID-19 related government order or rule, Verizon is required to ensure that all employees accessing our workplace comply with these mandatory requirements. If you work in one of these locations, you will be required to provide us with your vaccination status prior to joining. If this, or any other COVID related requirement applies in your location, we will notify you about this before you start work. When you join Verizon

ENGINEER A PROGRESSIVE CAREER WITH SNC-LAVALIN
SNC-Lavalin is one of the world’s leading professional services and project management organizations since 1911 with over 30,000 employees worldwide. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, data and technology to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects across the world. We are committed to having a diverse, flexible, and inclusive team that drives and shapes our business and we are proud to create opportunities for enthusiastic individuals looking to build their careers in Australia and globally.
At SNC-Lavalin, we have a global network of experienced experts who have contributed to some of the most unique and challenging projects. Our teams help clients understand and make decisions confidently in complex situations and we are always looking for the next generation of ‘big thinkers’ who want to be part of our team. We have created an inclusive, diverse and energised work environment and share an open culture founded on our values: SAFETY, INTEGRITY, INNOVATION, and COLLABORATION.
SNC-Lavalin is growing rapidly in Australia with new project wins offering exciting opportunities to learn and develop. With a strong reputation in the rail sector, we are expanding our service offering. Our regional business servicing the Australia & New Zealand markets is divided into three sectors:
1. Consulting and Advisory
2. Program & Project management
3. Design and Engineering
YOUR PROGESS is OUR PURPOSE
We’re not all the same, and that’s our greatest strength. Different views and opinions enhance our ability to provide value-added performance and better services for our clients. That’s why we believe different, makes a difference.
Our 18 months graduate program has been designed to give you an insight into the variety of opportunities on offer across our business and the chance to explore where your own specific skills and interests lie. Through a combination of on-the-job learning and practical skills development within your chosen role, you’ll work on real projects from day one that offer scale and variety collaborating with others and creating meaningful impact on the world around us.
With us, you’ll be working to change the world
Security is not a bolt on, nor is it a compliance exercise. Secure by Design aims to embed pragmatic security controls into your customers infrastructure informed by a lifecycle that utilises front-end operational impact analysis. It promotes a proven Systems Engineering process to establish and manage your customer’s Cyber risk to protect the safety, security, availability and integrity of your customers networks and assets. Whether as a designer, builder, architect, reviewer, assessor your job will involve liaising with our global team and helping your customer to achieve their desired outcome.
We will take you as a graduate on a journey and develop the following skills areas:
Applied practical experience with Industrial Control Systems (ICS), SCADA, and/or Operational Technology (OT) environments.
Strong understanding of key cyber security controls to be implemented within OT environments.
Strong understanding of OT networks, protocols, and assets/devices.
Ability to define and deliver services to internal and external customers, while achieving excellent customer satisfaction.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to excel in a high-paced, rapidly changing environment.
Ability to prioritize tasks and execute independently with limited supervision.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work with virtual teams to solve cyber security business challenges.
The successful applicant will be a self-motivated and proactive individual in their final year of Bachelor of Engineering in Systems engineering or Cyber Security discipline with 6.00 or above GPA and Internship experience would be an added advantage. They must have high attention to detail and ability to work independently and within a team environment. Applicants with Good analytical, reporting, communication skills and have willingness to travel are preferred.
Note: The opportunity is available in Sydney, Brisbane and Melbourne.
JOIN US TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE THAT MATTERS!
We’re on the lookout for the brightest minds to take up vital roles in shaping some of our exciting projects such as Cross River Rail, Inland Rail, Sydney Harbour Tunnel, New Western Harbour Tunnel Next Generation, Queensland Train Manufacturing Program, Integration and Delivery Partner – Sydney Metro, Sydney’s Barangaroo Ferry Hub, Project Energy Connect and more!
"Apply Now" to register your details and start your application journey.
Our deadline for applications is Tuesday 6th September 2022. Our programs are incredibly distinctive, and some roles may close early. So, avoid disappointment by getting your application in as soon as possible.
We weave Equality, Diversity & Inclusion into everything we do
“We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community - a place where we can all be ourselves, thrive and develop. To help embed inclusion for all, from day one, we offer a range of family friendly, inclusive employment policies, flexible working arrangements and employee networks to support staff from different backgrounds. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we value applications from all backgrounds, cultures and ability.”
Together, we can engineer a better future for our planet and its people.

Job no: 519867
Work type: Permanent Full Time
Location: Melbourne
Division: Business Services
Role and Responsibilities
The Security Compliance Analyst works for the Manager of Security Compliance, a team within the Governance, Compliance and Risk function of the Information Security Office (ISO). This role requires the ability to communicate to, and assist in presenting to IT leadership, Privacy and Office of General Counsel with regards to information security compliance and ongoing improvement of KPMG’s information security posture. The role must provide a balanced blend of business enablement while minimising information security risk, providing pragmatic advice to uphold policies and assisting project and stakeholder teams to work through compliance challenges.
The core functions of this role include:
Assess all aspects of information security compliance for KPMG Australia;
Assist in providing information security reporting to local IT leadership, regional and global leadership;
Coordinate with other aspects of the business including Legal, Privacy, P&I (HR), CISO, ITS and internal stakeholders within the business;
Assist the Security Compliance team in facilitating the annual external ISO27001/27017 audit, the internal Information Protection Controls Audit (IPCA) and any other reviews such as APRA CPS234 or NIST CSF;
Perform regular compliance reviews to ensure adherence to KPMG Policies, Procedures and Standards;
Perform regular reviews of KPMG Policies, Procedures and Standards to ensure they remain up to date and aligned to global documents;
Assist in developing and deploying the annual mandatory Security Awareness for Everyone (S.A.F.E.) training and quarterly Phishing Awareness training; track mandatory training completion by KPMG users;
Assist in working with ASPAC, regional or Global teams to implement broader information security initiatives;
Answer Client Queries about KPMG’s information security posture in a timely manner;
Liaise with OGC and the business to review client contracts’ security clauses to ensure KPMG can agree to the security clauses posed by clients, or amend as necessary;
Proactively provide assistance in other Security Compliance team work as needed.
Qualifications and Education Requirements

This role requires:

Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in an information or business-related discipline.
Minimum 1.5-2 years of experience in IT roles, preferably with involvement in a combination of compliance, auditing and service desk work.
Preferred, but not required to have accreditation in two of the following, ISO27001 Lead Auditor or Lead Implementor/CISM/Microsoft SC 900 - Security, Compliance and Identity Management; GCIH and/or CISSP (or relevant certifications)
A valid Australian Driver’s License (any State or territory)
Criminal Records Check and possible a National NV-1 security clearance
Preferred Knowledge / Skill / Ability

Key Responsibility Areas (Please list in order of importance)

Key Position Accountabilities

% of Total Role

Major Standards

What are the key activities or tasks to be carried out?

Outputs:
What are the expected end results?

How are these results measured?

Security Compliance Management

70%

Ensure all appropriate information security controls are implemented within KPMG, including conducting annual reviews and tracking findings.
Ensure Information security controls are embedded into KPMG’s processes.
Promote information security awareness and facilitate end-user training.
Assess security clauses within proposed client contracts to ensure alignment with KPMG’s information security posture, security policies and risk appetite.
Respond to Client Queries relating to KPMG’s information security posture in a timely manner, to enable the business to work with KPMG clients.
Establish a local process to review and ensure local/regional compliance with Global compliance requirements, systems and processes.


Assist in the assurance of effective Information Security Policies & Standards and testing compliance against the Policies & Standards.
Coordinate with the internal teams and stakeholders to timely conclude the security reviews. Liaising with the stakeholders to close/remediate open findings.
Assist in follow-up process for annual firm-wide training to confirm compliance and completion of the security training. Assist in publishing monthly firm-wide security awareness articles.
Assist in maintaining effective working relationships within the business by responding promptly to the active client queries/security assessments and contracts.
Assist in project reviews and assessments to ensure information security best practices.

Monitoring and compliance reporting.
Maintaining and ensuring Policies, Standards, and review documentation is up-to-date in the GRC tool.
External and Internal compliance audits
Awareness tests and records
Security requirements compliance
Agreed security performance/reporting metrics


Governance

15%

Responsible for tasks relating to information security by coordinating with representatives from different parts of the organization with relevant roles and job functions.
Working closely with other groups including the Partners, CISO, Legal, P&I or HR and meeting with them as needed (at least quarterly) to achieve the objectives of information security.
Assist in ensuring all local IT systems and initiatives are secure, meet published global security requirements, and do not conflict with Global IT direction/plans.
Assist in implementing new requirements as directed by IPG Global and Regional Security teams.
Assist in managing effective local information and security implementation of strategic activities with direction from KPMG International while accommodating any specific local requirements.
Review supplier and client contracts to determine any exposures to KPMG and provide consultation on mitigating liabilities.
Reviewing monthly and quarterly Key Risk Indicators and updating Cyber Risk Appetite Quarterly with the Head of Governance, Risk and Compliance.

 Assist in aligning information security with the business strategy to support the objectives of the organisation.
Effective communication amongst all business stakeholders, with strong constructive relationships and shared commitment.
Demonstrate value to the business by optimising information security investment and supporting business goals.
Comply and educate business key stakeholders on information security best practices.

Aligned to information security strategic plan
Aligned to standards, guidelines and procedures.
Close engagement with business stakeholders.
Reviewed and aligned to policies.


Global and regional alignment

15%

Assist in promoting relationships and participate in global focus groups and activities to drive the future direction of Global information security strategy and solutions.
Assist in driving the alignment of local solutions with global products, direction and strategy.

Definition of globally aligned information security components and policies to local firm objectives.

Deviations from globally policies are handled through exception processes.
Common understanding in the organisation of the benefits of global alignment.

Additional Notes

This is an information security role with a very strong focus on compliance with the firm’s strategic information security goals with enduring benefit for the firm and clients.


This position Should have an applied knowledge of the following tools, security frameworks and requirements:


NIST Cyber Security Framework and NIST Controls 800-53
ISO27001, ISO 27017, and ISO 31000 Cyber Compliance / Risk
Australian Cyber Security Centre Information Security Manual and Essential 8
PSPF / Government ISM
Australian Privacy Requirements
APRA CP234
PCI-DSS


Demonstrated Extensive experience using governance & risk tools

Advertised: 12 Aug 2022 AUS Eastern Standard Time
Applications close: Job no: 519867
Work type: Permanent Full Time
Location: Melbourne
Division: Business Services
Role and Responsibilities
The Security Compliance Analyst works for the Manager of Security Compliance, a team within the Governance, Compliance and Risk function of the Information Security Office (ISO). This role requires the ability to communicate to, and assist in presenting to IT leadership, Privacy and Office of General Counsel with regards to information security compliance and ongoing improvement of KPMG’s information security posture. The role must provide a balanced blend of business enablement while minimising information security risk, providing pragmatic advice to uphold policies and assisting project and stakeholder teams to work through compliance challenges.
The core functions of this role include:
Assess all aspects of information security compliance for KPMG Australia;
Assist in providing information security reporting to local IT leadership, regional and global leadership;
Coordinate with other aspects of the business including Legal, Privacy, P&I (HR), CISO, ITS and internal stakeholders within the business;
Assist the Security Compliance team in facilitating the annual external ISO27001/27017 audit, the internal Information Protection Controls Audit (IPCA) and any other reviews such as APRA CPS234 or NIST CSF;
Perform regular compliance reviews to ensure adherence to KPMG Policies, Procedures and Standards;
Perform regular reviews of KPMG Policies, Procedures and Standards to ensure they remain up to date and aligned to global documents;
Assist in developing and deploying the annual mandatory Security Awareness for Everyone (S.A.F.E.) training and quarterly Phishing Awareness training; track mandatory training completion by KPMG users;
Assist in working with ASPAC, regional or Global teams to implement broader information security initiatives;
Answer Client Queries about KPMG’s information security posture in a timely manner;
Liaise with OGC and the business to review client contracts’ security clauses to ensure KPMG can agree to the security clauses posed by clients, or amend as necessary;
Proactively provide assistance in other Security Compliance team work as needed.
Qualifications and Education Requirements

This role requires:

Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in an information or business-related discipline.
Minimum 1.5-2 years of experience in IT roles, preferably with involvement in a combination of compliance, auditing and service desk work.
Preferred, but not required to have accreditation in two of the following, ISO27001 Lead Auditor or Lead Implementor/CISM/Microsoft SC 900 - Security, Compliance and Identity Management; GCIH and/or CISSP (or relevant certifications)
A valid Australian Driver’s License (any State or territory)
Criminal Records Check and possible a National NV-1 security clearance
Preferred Knowledge / Skill / Ability
