Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges
At Honeywell, we make a lot of incredible things. But most importantly, we make the future, and are looking for people to join our team global team of future shapers. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our performance culture comprised of diverse leaders, thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who are changing the future. Our people are committed to each other and to the realisation of our vision through their unique job functions. Our businesses embrace the challenges of innovation so that we define the future. And our global opportunities are endless for you to grow and get recognised for your passion to perform.
We are seeking an experienced Cybersecurity Specialist to join our APAC ICT and Cybersecurity operations team. Reporting into the APAC ICT and Cybersecurity Operations Leader you will be responsible for enabling our teams to sell, install and service Cyber Security offerings securely, at speed and consistently across customer base.
In this dynamic role – your key responsibilities will involve working in collaboration with local leadership, sales and delivery teams to drive improvement and compliance of solutions with Honeywell and industry standards and best practices.
This role will form part of a growing global ICT and Cybersecurity Operations team responsible for designing, delivering, and maintaining complex and critical ICT infrastructure and systems as part of larger technology solutions. This includes remote services, large servers/storage/virtualisation deployments, wired and wireless networks, and cyber security assessments/validation.
This role will suit a highly motivated person who enjoys working to the highest standards, in a fast-paced technical environment with a variety of technology.
Key Responsibilities:
 Assume support and/or lead role in assigned projects/service contracts ensuring cybersecurity/networks scope is delivered on time and within budget and to the satisfaction of the customer.
 Implement security controls and processes to protect deployed solutions
 Conduct security assessment to ensure compliance against Honeywell and industry standards.
 Set the IT security framework and maintenance practices our services teams should be working to, to ensure our customer deployed systems are kept secure.
 Keep technically current with networking and certified wireless product/systems portfolio, while maintaining expert knowledge on specific designated network disciplines.
 Support in the identification of new IT security partners, qualification and testing of equipment to form part of wider solutions.
 Maintain cyber security certifications and keep technically current with the security requirements, while maintaining expert knowledge on specific designated disciplines
 Develop sound and trusted relationships with internal and external customers by providing accurate and efficient technical/engineering support.
 Protect the integrity of the Honeywell implemented software, server and network infrastructure and services by managing access, monitoring global ICT security news and technological developments, and acting on these using vendor advice and current technical knowledge.

Key Experience, Qualifications and Capabilities:
 Bachelor in Information Technology / Systems or Computer Science
 Relevant Cyber Security certifications and/or training including CISSP, CEH etc
 Certification and/or Training in relevant ICT industry technologies such as MCSA/MCSE (Microsoft), CCNA/CCNP/CCDP/CCIE (Cisco), VCP (VMware), CA (Citrix) or similar is desirable
 5-10 years experience in Cyber Security / Network Engineering or equivalent capacity.
 Experience in performing security audits/assessments, design/implementation/hardening networks.
 Knowledge of appropriate security industry regulations and standards such as ISA-99/ISA-62443 , NERC CIP, NIST and ISO/IEC 27001.
 Experience with security scanners: nmap, Nessus and other open source tools.
 Possess sound knowledge of Cisco Networking Switches & Firewall Devices.
 Excellent troubleshooting skills to resolve complex network and or application or system integration issues.
 Experience in pre-sales consultancy, translating requirements into Cybersecurity solutions (desirable).
About Us
The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.
Discover More
We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/
If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.
The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.

Exempt  Show more

Responsibilities

About the Company:
Started in 2014 by accounting and banking technologists, Eftsure, based in North Sydney, is a fast-scaling SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) Fraud Technology platform that protects the B2B payments of Australian businesses by providing real-time vendor (supplier) verification and real-time payment protection. In a world of explosive and evolving cybercrime and payment fraud we ensure our customers never pay the wrong people. Our software solution does this in a variety of ways across a business’s payment process but notably by providing real-time alerts in the form of red and green thumbs on our customers online banking payment screen.
Our (lofty) mission is to be the new digital security standard for B2B payments. With over 600 of Australia’s leading businesses as customers, monitoring over $75b in payments per year, and a substantial new investment by New York Growth Equity firm, Level Equity, we are making strides towards that goal.

About the Role:
Eftsure provides payment verification services to hundreds of customers. The entire company is focussed on ensuring security is key in everything we do. The Compliance Officer will join the security team and help ensure that Eftsure compliance and certification programs are current and continue to follow best practice. This will require experience working with ISO 27001 certifications and audit processes, assisting with the vetting of new vendors for compliance and also identifying and mitigating IT & Cyber Security risks. The role will include answering security and policy compliance due diligence questionnaires as required by our customers, as well as discussing those responses with customers.
The prime focus of this role is compliance across the entire company and ensuring Eftsure continually follows best practice as it relates to security and compliance, and ultimately continue delivering safe and secure services at the highest level.

This opportunity is a permanent, full-time opportunity, will be able to work in our North Sydney Office and work from home.

Specific Key responsibilities:
Working through all ISO27001 Information Security policy and certification requirements including the ISO audit processes. This incorporates all ongoing activities working with the entire team to review, develop and maintain Information Security Management System documentation required by ISO (ie. Scope, Policy and Statement of Applicability), and relevant policies and procedures that form the basis for compliance with ISO27001
Reviewing and responding to security requirements of customer originated contracts
Responding to the Security, Governance, Risk, Compliance, Privacy and ISO Certifications sections of tenders
Keeping up to date on statutory & regulatory requirements and ensuring we continually comply with new regulations
Assisting in scheduling and running Business Continuity Plan tests, recording findings and documenting any subsequent actions to be taken
Assess & record any newly identified Risks & Issues in the Risk & Issues Registers
Working alongside the Business, IT and development teams to assist and ensure ongoing compliance with policies and certifications
Coordinating and assisting with both internal and external audits, including our AWS and ISO Certifications
Monitoring and maintaining various AWS security features and capabilities
Reviewing and responding to relevant security alerts
Regular user account access reviews and revalidations
Skills & Experience:
Relevant tertiary IT qualifications in management, audit, Cyber Security
Minimum 4 years experience in a similar role
Previous experience driving the ISO27001 certification audit processes
Previous experience in coordinating and being heavily involved in accreditation programs and answering security due diligence questions of customers
Strong project management understanding and organisational skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong stakeholder management skills
Detailed understanding of security threats and mitigations in SaaS environments
Experience in working with AWS particularly around securing AWS and the various AWS tools such as Cloud Trail, Cloud Watch, Inspector, and Security Groups
Experience working within security and audit teams
AWS System Administrator skills including the ability to analyse and respond to security alerts would be a significant advantage

Culture:
Eftsure is a fast growing Fraudtech with a welcoming and friendly culture to all. Employees at all levels are self motivated, team players that assist each other wherever they can. We strive to ensure an almost family like atmosphere where the goal is for everyone to feel comfortable and supported. We believe it’s important that everyone is treated with respect and welcome new ideas and inputs. We encourage all staff to talk to anyone in the organisation whether it is to suggest an idea, a better way of doing things or to highlight an issue or an error. Key in the culture is to not be fearful of disclosing a mistake but rather know that the team and management will help mitigate the consequence and assist in rectifying it. We want employees to enjoy their work, work hard but have fun doing it.

Benefits:
Competitive salary
IBS Intelligence rates Eftsure as One of the 5 top payments players disrupting the industry in Australia
Flexible working hours including hybrid work from home, great location casual work environment
Opportunity for further learning, development and upskilling
Convenient North Sydney location
Immediate start

Eftsure is a fast growing Fraudtech with a welcoming and friendly culture to all. Employees at all levels are self motivated, team players that assist each other wherever they can. We strive to ensure an almost family like atmosphere where the goal is for everyone to feel comfortable and supported. We believe it’s important that everyone is treated with respect and welcome new ideas and inputs. We encourage all staff to talk to anyone in the organisation whether it is to suggest an idea, a better way of doing things or to highlight an issue or an error. Key in the culture is to not be fearful of disclosing a mistake but rather know that the team and management will help mitigate the consequence and assist in rectifying it. We want employees to enjoy their work, work hard but have fun doing it.

Benefits:
Competitive salary
IBS Intelligence rates Eftsure as One of the 5 top payments players disrupting the industry in Australia
Flexible working hours including hybrid work from home, great location casual work environment
Opportunity for further learning, development and upskilling
Convenient North Sydney location

About the Company:
Started in 2014 by accounting and banking technologists, Eftsure, based in North Sydney, is a fast-scaling SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) Fraud Technology platform that protects the B2B payments of Australian businesses by providing real-time vendor (supplier) verification and real-time payment protection. In a world of explosive and evolving cybercrime and payment fraud we ensure our customers never pay the wrong people. Our software solution does this in a variety of ways across a business’s payment process but notably by providing real-time alerts in the form of red and green thumbs on our customers online banking payment screen.
Our (lofty) mission is to be the new digital security standard for B2B payments. With over 600 of Australia’s leading businesses as customers, monitoring over $75b in payments per year, and a substantial new investment by New York Growth Equity firm, Level Equity, we are making strides towards that goal.

About the Role:
Eftsure provides payment verification services to hundreds of customers. The entire company is focussed on ensuring security is key in everything we do. The Compliance Officer will join the security team and help ensure that Eftsure compliance and certification programs are current and continue to follow best practice. This will require experience working with ISO 27001 certifications and audit processes, assisting with the vetting of new vendors for compliance and also identifying and mitigating IT & Cyber Security risks. The role will include answering security and policy compliance due diligence questionnaires as required by our customers, as well as discussing those responses with customers.
The prime focus of this role is compliance across the entire company and ensuring Eftsure continually follows best practice as it relates to security and compliance, and ultimately continue delivering safe and secure services at the highest level.

This opportunity is a permanent, full-time opportunity, will be able to work in our North Sydney Office and work from home.

Specific Key responsibilities:
Working through all ISO27001 Information Security policy and certification requirements including the ISO audit processes. This incorporates all ongoing activities working with the entire team to review, develop and maintain Information Security Management System documentation required by ISO (ie. Scope, Policy and Statement of Applicability), and relevant policies and procedures that form the basis for compliance with ISO27001
Reviewing and responding to security requirements of customer originated contracts
Responding to the Security, Governance, Risk, Compliance, Privacy and ISO Certifications sections of tenders
Keeping up to date on statutory & regulatory requirements and ensuring we continually comply with new regulations
Assisting in scheduling and running Business Continuity Plan tests, recording findings and documenting any subsequent actions to be taken
Assess & record any newly identified Risks & Issues in the Risk & Issues Registers
Working alongside the Business, IT and development teams to assist and ensure ongoing compliance with policies and certifications
Coordinating and assisting with both internal and external audits, including our AWS and ISO Certifications
Monitoring and maintaining various AWS security features and capabilities
Reviewing and responding to relevant security alerts
Regular user account access reviews and revalidations
Skills & Experience:
Relevant tertiary IT qualifications in management, audit, Cyber Security
Minimum 4 years experience in a similar role
Previous experience driving the ISO27001 certification audit processes
Previous experience in coordinating and being heavily involved in accreditation programs and answering security due diligence questions of customers
Strong project management understanding and organisational skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong stakeholder management skills
Detailed understanding of security threats and mitigations in SaaS environments
Experience in working with AWS particularly around securing AWS and the various AWS tools such as Cloud Trail, Cloud Watch, Inspector, and Security Groups
Experience working within security and audit teams
AWS System Administrator skills including the ability to analyse and respond to security alerts would be a significant advantage

Culture:
Eftsure is a fast growing Fraudtech with a welcoming and friendly culture to all. Employees at all levels are self motivated, team players that assist each other wherever they can. We strive to ensure an almost family like atmosphere where the goal is for everyone to feel comfortable and supported. We believe it’s important that everyone is treated with respect and welcome new ideas and inputs. We encourage all staff to talk to anyone in the organisation whether it is to suggest an idea, a better way of doing things or to highlight an issue or an error. Key in the culture is to not be fearful of disclosing a mistake but rather know that the team and management will help mitigate the consequence and assist in rectifying it. We want employees to enjoy their work, work hard but have fun doing it.

Benefits:
Competitive salary

Flexible working hours including hybrid work from home, great location casual work environment
Opportunity for further learning, development and upskilling

Company Description
About Us
The racing world is not just exciting, it brings communities together across the state. Racing and Wagering Western Australia (RWWA) is at the centre of this world and more than 24,000 people choose to join us in our quest to forge a sustainable future for racing in WA.
As well as controlling thoroughbred, harness, and greyhound racing in Western Australia, RWWA operates the TAB which has more than 300 off-course retail outlets, a call centre and online betting services. Our motto is Better Your Bet because increasing profits through Western Australia’s own TAB means better returns for the local racing sector and state-wide communities.
Our business is unique, which means we can offer careers which are interesting, challenging, and diverse. Our values are important to us so, to be successful, you will have to share them. We are honest, real, and positive and we pride ourselves on achieving great outcomes for our customers. We work hard but have fun while we are doing it.
Whatever your passion, our success is a team sport.
Job Description
The Role
The primary purpose of this role is to implement, monitor and respond to events and alerts across the Microsoft 365 platform, and to increase the awareness of security events across the business.
This is a Maximum Term Contract with flexibility to work remotely (Australia only)
Some of your key duties will include:
Responsibility for configuring log management tools across the Microsoft 365 platform, with the objective being to produce meaningful and actionable alerts.
Monitoring, tuning and responding to these alerts, and coordinating with other teams to resolve them in a timely manner.
Expanding the functionality of the platform, and training other team members in the use of M365 tools.
Assist with information security issues related to audit responses and risk management activities.
Please note the successful applicant will be required to work as part of an on call roster.
Qualifications
About You
Experience with Microsoft Sentinel, O365 security controls, user rights review management.
Knowledge of modern firewall, vulnerability management and endpoint protection tools.
Knowledge of AWS security controls and alerts will be beneficial.
Knowledge of industry security standards, such as ISO 27001, ISO 27002 and PCI DSS.
Knowledge of Australian Cyber Security Centre Essential 8.
Relevant tertiary qualification and / or equivalent relevant experience.
Exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to use initiative and good judgement to analyse and make recommendations to address common workplace issues
Additional Information
The Reward
Work at an organisation that is vibrant, fun, and diverse
Flexible working arrangements available
Leave loading paid on your annual leave
Onsite parking available
Salary packaging options
Employee Assistance Program – for both the employee and immediate family
Extensive wellness programs (including discounted health insurance, onsite yoga, free mindfulness apps and much more)
Next Steps
If you are looking for a new challenge in a culture of autonomy and flexibility with a resilient and growing business, apply today.
Please include your current resume and a short cover letter relating to why you’re interested and suitable for the role. Company Description

About Us
The racing world is not just exciting, it brings communities together across the state. Racing and Wagering Western Australia (RWWA) is at the centre of this world and more than 24,000 people choose to join us in our quest to forge a sustainable future for racing in WA.
As well as controlling thoroughbred, harness, and greyhound racing in Western Australia, RWWA operates the TAB which has more than 300 off-course retail outlets, a call centre and online betting services. Our motto is Better Your Bet because increasing profits through Western Australia’s own TAB means better returns for the local racing sector and state-wide communities.
Our business is unique, which means we can offer careers which are interesting, challenging, and diverse. Our values are important to us so, to be successful, you will have to share them. We are honest, real, and positive and we pride ourselves on achieving great outcomes for our customers. We work hard but have fun while we are doing it.
Whatever your passion, our success is a team sport. 
Job Description
The Role
The primary purpose of this role is to implement, monitor and respond to events and alerts across the Microsoft 365 platform, and to increase the awareness of security events across the business.
This is a Maximum Term Contract with flexibility to work remotely (Australia only)
Some of your key duties will include:
Responsibility for configuring log management tools across the Microsoft 365 platform, with the objective being to produce meaningful and actionable alerts.
Monitoring, tuning and responding to these alerts, and coordinating with other teams to resolve them in a timely manner.
Expanding the functionality of the platform, and training other team members in the use of M365 tools.
Assist with information security issues related to audit responses and risk management activities.
Please note the successful applicant will be required to work as part of an on call roster. 
Job Description 
The Role

Assist with information security issues related to audit responses and risk management activities.
Please note the successful applicant will be required to work as part of an on call roster. 
Qualifications
About You
Experience with Microsoft Sentinel, O365 security controls, user rights review management.
Knowledge of modern firewall, vulnerability management and endpoint protection tools.
Knowledge of AWS security controls and alerts will be beneficial.
Knowledge of industry security standards, such as ISO 27001, ISO 27002 and PCI DSS.
Knowledge of Australian Cyber Security Centre Essential 8.
Relevant tertiary qualification and / or equivalent relevant experience.
Exceptional problem-solving skills, with the ability to use initiative and good judgement to analyse and make recommendations to address common workplace issues

About Us
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

Short Description:
The Customer Success Manager is responsible for overall client satisfaction and reference ability, building and managing long-term business relationships between Infosys and assigned client accounts.

Location : Melbourne, Australia
About the Role & Responsibilities:
This role serves as a customer advocate and business consultant for multiple small accounts or a large account by helping our clients achieve success through the use of multiple Cyber Security products and services. This role is all about client satisfaction
Manage the business relationship between Infosys and assigned client accounts; responsible for overall client satisfaction
Provide coaching and advice to clients on the use of Infosys’s solutions for Cyber Security problems.
Monitor accounts for change in solution/product usage, personnel, goals, mission, financial conditions, competitor involvement and other areas that could have an effect on the clients’ ongoing use and/or satisfaction with Infosys’s services
Provide strategic updates on clients’ performance to Infosys Senior Management. Provide regular status updates to account teams and Sales Managers
Identify new opportunities for expanding Infosys’s Cyber Security service usage to maximize client success and Infosys revenue growth
Ensure maintenance and contract renewal
About you:
Strong customer facing skills (executive presence, writing skills, phone skills). Demonstrates a highly professional demeanour
Strong consulting skills. Ability to gather and analyse information and produce strategic insights into clients’ organizational and technical challenges
Ability to communicate technical details to a non-technical audience. Ability to set and communicate expectations; skill in mediating and resolving problems
Must be highly organized and able to prioritize and process a number of tasks concurrently
Ability to build lasting relationships based on trust
Takes ownership of customer issues and drives to resolution
Self-motivated, strong work ethic, creative, customer-centric personality
Responsible for competency enablement and bringing innovation, automation
Responsible for Client’s Security posture improvement
Technical leader to lead a team and ensure people management for the team
Education:- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience (technical degree or master’s degree a plus)
-

companyName: Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet
listing_jobDesc:
Location: Barton, ACT
Application Closing Date: 01-Sep-2022

Classification

Executive Level 1 ($113,627 - $129,502)

Employment Type

Ongoing & Non-ongoing (For a period of up to 18 months)

This role is being advertised as both ongoing and non-ongoing, with the employment type to be determined in negotiation with the preferred candidate and the PM&C delegate.

Where a non-ongoing specified term is offered, this would be for an initial period of up to 18 months, with possibility of extension up to a maximum period of three years.


A non-ongoing offer may result in conversion to an ongoing offer of employment, however this must occur within 18 months from the opening date of this advertisement.

Flexible Work

Flexible working arrangements will be considered

The Opportunity


National Security Division provides whole of government advice on ways to enhance the safety, security and prosperity of all Australians. We coordinate and lead whole of government efforts to progress our national interests across the Government's national security priorities, including defence, intelligence, international and domestic security.


As an Adviser in the National Security Division, you will support the development and implementation of national security policy and advice to the Prime Minister and senior officials within the Department. You will have the opportunity to work in a highly skilled and experienced team environment that values initiative, respect and collaboration. The work is interesting and challenging, often fast-paced, and requires a high degree of autonomy.

You will work on a variety of issues and may be responsible for:

providing accurate, concise and timely advice to the Prime Minister on defence policy, defence capability, countering foreign interference, cyber security, counter-terrorism, law enforcement, domestic and border security, intelligence policy and national security strategy.
liaison with national security stakeholders to ensure a whole of government approach to implementation of major policies and programs.
preparing high quality briefings to support the Government's consideration of related policy, legislation, budgetary and topical issues.
preparing high quality briefings to support the deliberation of Cabinet, the National Security Committee of Cabinet and the Secretaries’ Committee on National Security.


At PM&C, we recognise the broad benefits of offering flexibility in how, when and where work is performed. We promote, support and enable flexible work practices, and our commitment is to consider flexibility first, from a starting position of ‘how can we make this work’.


In National Security Division, we recognise that people’s needs and responsibilities are varied. We support work arrangements that promote the wellbeing and work, life balance of our staff. Examples of current work arrangements in place in NSD include part time, remote work and working from home, flexible start and finish times and compressed hours (compressing ordinary working hours into fewer working days).


While operational requirements means that not all of our work can be done from home, you’ll be equipped to work flexibly where you can. PM&C uses space and technology well, and a mix of digital tools to get the best out of flexibility. The roles are fast paced, challenging and varied. You will gain unparalleled insight into the development of strategic policy and unique exposure to the wider PM&C, APS and national security communities.

Our Ideal Candidate

We are seeking highly motivated candidates who thrive in busy and dynamic environments. We strongly value diversity, and you will have a unique perspective and experiences to bring to the role.


Working in a small division with broad responsibilities, our ideal candidate will:


be able to quickly absorb new material and provide considered, succinct policy advice.
have strong analytical and written communication skills, including the ability to quickly and accurately synthesise material from a diverse range of sources into targeted briefing for the Prime Minister.
have excellent attention to detail. Candidates should have the judgement and resilience to manage competing priorities with limited supervision.
have strong interpersonal skills, working well in a team environment and able to liaise effectively across the division, department and broader Australian Government.
To be successful at the EL1 level, candidates will need to demonstrate strong independent problem solving and critical thinking skills and have a proven ability to deliver complex tasks to a high standard.

Prior experience working in government and/or on national security, foreign policy, defence or international economic issues is desirable but not essential. We value a broad range of experience from public and private sector and the diverse perspectives varied experience can bring.

Eligibility


To be eligible for this position you must be an Australian Citizen.


The successful candidate will be required to be assessed through our pre-employment screening checks, such as an Australian Criminal History Check.

Security Clearance Required


Negative Vetting Level 2 (Top Secret NV)

Contact Officer


Gemma Smyth on (02) 6271 5949 or gemma.smyth@pmc.gov.au


Please Note – This is an unclassified web based recruitment system so your application must not contain any classified or sensitive information. This includes in your one page pitch and resume.

Please Note – This is an unclassified web based recruitment system so your application must not contain any classified or sensitive information. This includes in your one page pitch and resume.  Candidate Information Pack.docx

  Candidate Information Pack.pdf  Show more

The Role:
The Cyber Security Analyst is responsible for monitoring customer SIEM incidents and alerts, as well as managing and performing minor configuration of security monitoring tools. They prioritise alerts or issues and perform initial triage to confirm a real security incident is taking place.
Some of the areas you can expect to be accountable for include but are not limited to:
Monitor client networks and endpoints for security alerts relating to compromise or intrusion.
Threat hunting to proactively search for malicious activities, combining known attacker intelligence, indicators of compromise and advanced analytics.
Undertake cloud security health and vulnerability assessments.
Handling incidents as per defined service level metrics.
Triage and provide initial investigation into security alerts from the SIEM platforms.
Developing processes/procedures, runbooks for security alerts.
Monitor the components of the Security Monitoring service for operational issues and escalate as required.
Develop changes impacting SOC monitoring capability and manage ambiguity through collaboration, education and knowledge sharing.
Engage with subject matter experts and the project team to facilitate new monitoring requirements through the use case development process.
Essential Qualifications:
Diploma/Certificate/Degree in Information Technology (Security preferred) OR
Relevant industry certifications such as CEH, GCIH, Security+, Network+, MCSP, CCNA)
Related Experience:
3+ years’ as a security analyst or working in a cyber security operations centre
3+ years’ experience working with standard operating systems (Windows, Unix)
Hands-on experience with one or more SIEM systems (ArcSight, Splunk, Sentinel, Qradar, Sumologic etc.) and Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) technologies.
Understanding of TCP/IP and networking concepts (OSI Model)
Knowledge of IT security controls (Network IPS, Vulnerability Scanning, Endpoint Protection, Firewalls, Cloud Access Security Brokers)
Azure Cloud services
Recent experience in a similar position
As our clients are primarily government, you will need to be an Australian Citizen who holds an minimum Baseline security clearance or the ability to obtain.
Digital61 welcomes applicants from all backgrounds. We support diverse perspectives and innovative thinking which is critical to our success. We support flexible working arrangements to accommodate for individual circumstances.
Digital61 does not accept or appreciate unsolicited calls or applications from recruitment agencies.
You will need to be located in the Canberra region to be considered for this position.
How to Apply
Please send your resume to recruitment@digital61.com.au The Role:
The Cyber Security Analyst is responsible for monitoring customer SIEM incidents and alerts, as well as managing and performing minor configuration of security monitoring tools. They prioritise alerts or issues and perform initial triage to confirm a real security incident is taking place.
Some of the areas you can expect to be accountable for include but are not limited to:
Monitor client networks and endpoints for security alerts relating to compromise or intrusion.
Threat hunting to proactively search for malicious activities, combining known attacker intelligence, indicators of compromise and advanced analytics.
Undertake cloud security health and vulnerability assessments.
Handling incidents as per defined service level metrics.
Triage and provide initial investigation into security alerts from the SIEM platforms.
Developing processes/procedures, runbooks for security alerts.
Monitor the components of the Security Monitoring service for operational issues and escalate as required.
Develop changes impacting SOC monitoring capability and manage ambiguity through collaboration, education and knowledge sharing.
Engage with subject matter experts and the project team to facilitate new monitoring requirements through the use case development process.

Diploma/Certificate/Degree in Information Technology (Security preferred) OR
Relevant industry certifications such as CEH, GCIH, Security+, Network+, MCSP, CCNA)

3+ years’ as a security analyst or working in a cyber security operations centre
3+ years’ experience working with standard operating systems (Windows, Unix)

Understanding of TCP/IP and networking concepts (OSI Model)
Knowledge of IT security controls (Network IPS, Vulnerability Scanning, Endpoint Protection, Firewalls, Cloud Access Security Brokers)
Azure Cloud services
Recent experience in a similar position

Date: 05-Aug-2022

Location:
Brisbane, QLD, AU

Department: Risk Advisory

Description:
Job Requisition ID: 26443

What will your typical day look like?
Based in Brisbane, we are looking for a Senior Analyst to support our Cyber Risk team. You will bring a strong balance of technical experience, communication and interpersonal skills, which will enable you to engage at all levels of an organisation around the cyber risk agenda. A wide range of security advisory services, such as cyber security strategy, managed security services, threat and risk assessments, security design, testing and transformation. You will work within a diverse team who are passionate about helping organisations to assess, define and sustainably implement cyber security capability.

As a Senior Analyst, you will support the delivery of advisory and implementation projects and contribute to the culture of learning and impact within our cyber risk practice.

About the team

Positioned first globally in Security Consulting Services for the 6th year in a row? Yes, that's Deloitte. We are known for excellence in security strategy and transformation services. Our cyber risk practice has deep capabilities across cyber strategy and governance; cloud and infrastructure; identity and access management; attack and response; data protection and application security.

Enough about us, let's talk about you.

You are someone with:

A passion for cyber security and proven experience in a cyber security role
Strong communication and problem-solving skills
Progress towards or completion of certifications is highly desirable e.g. CISSP, CISM, CCSP, CISA, OSCP, CEH, Security+
Experience in performing security threat and risk assessments and delivering projects relating to managed security services, security strategy, governance, security architecture and capability improvement
Experience working with leading industry security frameworks – detailed knowledge of NIST, PSPF and ISM will be strongly regarded.
Technical experience in relation to managed security services, cloud security, end point security, identity and access management or data protection will be strongly regarded
A strong desire to develop your leadership skills and impact, working across a range of digital and cyber transformation programs
You are a team player, collaborative and want to help your clients access the best of Deloitte by working closely with your peers in other capital cities and other countries with relevant 3+ years of experience in cyber security or related area.

Why Deloitte?

We create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders, value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. People work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive. Work in the exciting World of Broadcasting in Cyber Security!Full time permanent roleNorth Sydney Location - Hybrid Working arrangementAt SBS, we embrace difference, and we welcome applications from people of all backgrounds.We also acknowledge the unique contribution that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples make to our society and our workplace through their enduring and continued connection to land, sea, sky, and community.About UsSBS is one of the world's most unique and innovative media organisations, producing trusted, meaningful, and engaging content that exists for all Australians to inspire, support, and celebrate the diversity of our multicultural society.Our purpose, for the last 40 years, has reflected and explored the evolving diversity of Australia, investing in initiatives to deepen its connections with communities, sharing their stories and giving a voice to those often unheard, with the aim of increasing understanding and respect of the differences that make up Australia.SBS is a truly distinctive network, showcasing multicultural, multilingual and First Nations stories otherwise untold in the Australian media.The RoleThe primary purpose of the Cyber Security Analyst is to provide cyber security, assess risk and provide technical expertise to support SBS’s cyber security.This role will work have you working alongside an experienced team of cyber security professionals and include performing a wide range of responsibilities which include threat and vulnerability management, SIEM operation, incident response, and cyber security risk assessment.Fostering security awareness and supporting initiatives to improve SBS’s security maturity is also an essential part of the role.It is a requirement of this role that incumbents are fully vaccinated with an approved Covid-19 vaccination in line with the ATAGI guidelines which include booster shots. We do however have a medical exemption process and we would be happy to discuss your application should this be applicable to you.About YouExperience in Cyber Security or a related role, having exposure to Cyber Security within the media industry would be a significant advantage.A passion for Cyber Security and Threat intelligence with an ability to assess a situation using multiple data sources and to make a judgement on how to best proceed.Good communication skills and feel comfortable talking to groups of people to present on topics related to Cyber Security.The core skills required to excel in this role are:Familiar with the cloud computing (Azure, AWS, etc), networking, firewall, and ITSM conceptsKnowledge of standards and frameworks including, NIST, ASD Essential 8Experience working with Linux and/or Unix based systems as well as Microsoft Windows operating systemsDesire to be a hands-on technologistKnowledge of Data Loss Prevention, Endpoint Protection, SIEM solutionsGood understanding of access control, security protocols, vulnerability management, incident, and event managementBe willing to work flexibly in response to cyber incidentsUniversity degree or equivalent IT certification or qualificationKnowledge of Microsoft Windows Active Directory and Azure Active DirectoryThe following are some desirables we are also seeking:Exposure to MITRE ATT&CK Framework and cyber kill-chainAbility to understand various scripting languages such as PythonSkills or experience with tools or techniques used in digital forensics and/or threat huntingExperience with tools such as CrowdStrike, Carbon Black, Zimmerman Tools, Velociraptor and TenableExperience with Elasticsearch, Splunk and Microsoft Windows Active Directory and Azure Active DirectorySome of the reasons to consider working with usThe people! We truly celebrate and welcome difference at SBS and encourage everyone to bring their whole self to work, you’ll be part of one of the most inclusive companies in Australia!The culture and the engagement of our workforce! SBS is ranked in the top 25% of all media companies for employee engagementWe offer a range of benefits; from flexible work arrangements, health checks, salary packaging, an employee assistance program and free gym membership.We’re agile and innovative in the way we work, as well as being a trusted and established brand. At SBS we have been broadcasting for over 40 years and our future is packed with many more exciting developments!We also love to promote from within! We have allocated training funds to do just that and help bridge the gaps when moving from role to role.Want to learn more? Then hit apply and take the first step to applying not just for another job but a possible whole new career in a purpose led organisation!Not quite the right role for you? No problem, how about popping your details into our talent pool? Email us at noreplytalentpool@sbs.com.au to let us know what roles would be of interest to you and we will keep you informed of when they arise! (If you no longer want to be listed in our talent pool, then just email us and let us know and we will remove your detail).For other opportunities within our organisation please visit our careers website SBS Careers - Working at SBSReasonable adjustmentsSBS recognises that everyone is unique, and you might require some adjustments to ensure you have the best opportunity to apply and put your skills forward for consideration. If we can make some adjustments to the SBS recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, then please contact careers@sbs.com.au and let us know.Adjustments may include but are not limited to; alternative application methods, interview setups, physical requirements, guidance for trans or gender diverse applicants, specific interview availability times and more.We are shortlisting applications as they come in, so don’t delay apply today!To apply online, please go to http://sbs.com.au/careers/Job Type: Full-time Work in the exciting World of Broadcasting in Cyber Security!Full time permanent roleNorth Sydney Location - job_title: Cyber Security Engineer Level 3 - SOAR Engineer
listing_jobDesc:
Cyber Security Engineer Level 3 - SOAR Engineer

At NTT we believe that by using innovative technology we can solve global challenges and create a world that is sustainable and secure. We are looking for curious people, from diverse backgrounds, that are keen to work in a fast-paced and agile environment.

At NTT we trust our employees to do the right thing, even when no one is watching, which is why we offer flexibility in the workplace. The majority of our roles are hybrid, meaning we encourage a balance of working from home and our local office. Ask our recruitment team if this is a hybrid role.

Want to be a part of our team?

NTT is looking for a Level 3 Cyber Security Engineer to join our managed services team on a permanent position.


This resource will be part of NTT's Cyber Security Incident Response (CSIR) team. The CSIR team is essential in providing an orchestrated and rapid security incident response capability with an oversight of security incident response across wider NTT Managed Security Services clients. The CSIR team utilise various security technologies to identify alerts, prioritize and investigate security issues in a fast-paced environment maintain the level of communication with internal and client stakeholders.

The Cyber Security SOAR Engineers vision is to deliver the security automation agenda across managed services security clients supported by NTT and continuously evolve the team and practice capabilities to align with new technology and services and help disrupt the way we deliver to our clients.

Working at NTT

What does your day look like within the team?

Create a link between development and operations by applying a software engineering mindset to system administration activities
Design, innovate and build large scale automations to provide efficiencies to NTT and our clients
Help drive a cultural movement of automation across the business and coach others who are learning a new way of working via code and automation
Automating infrastructure technologies with a modern approach aligned to things such as Infrastructure as Code, Configuration as Code, and DevOps
Participate in team planning activities and ensure progress is being made against the business objectives
Document automation processes and runbooks across staging, production, and technical administration tasks
Work closely with our operational engineering teams and provide consulting and troubleshooting to alleviate the pressures with operational and reliability issues
Work closely with technology subject matter experts and business analyst to understand requirements and automation use cases
Work with our technical management office (TMO) to participate in the technology standards lifecycle
Promote standardization and automation across infrastructure that we support and manage for our clients
Maintain existing automation infrastructure used to identify risks in areas such as performance, reliability, capability and scalability
Be responsible for deployment, maintenance, and enhancements of automation workflows (own your code)
Follow the change and release processes to prevent production outages and ensure engineers who operate the automation know how to operate it
Participate in post incident reviews and documenting findings and act on their learnings and enhancements of your code

What will make you a good fit for the role?

Mandatory requirements:

At least 3-5 years of experience in Automation technologies: (Palo Alto xSOAR, or other SOAR solutions, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes)
Analytics technologies: (ElasticSearch, PowerBI, JSON)
At least 3-5 years of experience in Coding technologies: (Python, PowerShell, Source Code Management)
Atlassian technologies: (Jira, Confluence)
Proficiency in at least one programming language i.e. python
At least 8 - 12 years of experience in a technical support environment working with Firewall - Checkpoint, Palo Alto, Cisco, Juniper, Proxy - BlueCoat, Zscalerr and F5 security products.

Technology domain requirements:

Security technologies for example firewalls, antivirus, IPS, access controls
Cyber Security Operations SIEM solutions like (Splunk ES, Microsoft Sentinel).
Cloud technologies for example AWS, Azure, GCP
Data Centre technologies for example storage, and servers

Behavioural skills:

Passion for coding / scripting, automation and innovation
Positive attitude and willingness to learn
Ability to critically examine a system and use that to guide them when asking questions of the system
Maintaining good relationships with engineering teams
Big picture mindset and enjoy problem solving
Highly analytical with a level of business value and outcomes focused
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to engage with stakeholders
You are naturally curious with the ability to manage tight deadlines


Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

Equal opportunity employer
NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.



Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

For more information about this or other opportunities, please contact Dennis Anderson. Please quote our job reference number 571713.

About us

NTT Ltd. is a global ICT provider, employing more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace, and delivering services in over 200 countries and regions. We partner with organizations around the world to shape and achieve outcomes through intelligent technology solutions. For us, intelligent means data driven, connected, digital, and secure.

NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category. Atlassian technologies: (Jira, Confluence)
Proficiency in at least one programming language i.e. python
At least 8 - 12 years of experience in a technical support environment working with Firewall - Checkpoint, Palo Alto, Cisco, Juniper, Proxy - BlueCoat, Zscalerr and F5 security products.

Technology domain requirements:

Security technologies for example firewalls, antivirus, IPS, access controls
Cyber Security Operations SIEM solutions like (Splunk ES, Microsoft Sentinel).
Cloud technologies for example AWS, Azure, GCP
Data Centre technologies for example storage, and servers

Behavioural skills:

Passion for coding / scripting, automation and innovation
Positive attitude and willingness to learn
Ability to critically examine a system and use that to guide them when asking questions of the system
Maintaining good relationships with engineering teams
Big picture mindset and enjoy problem solving
Highly analytical with a level of business value and outcomes focused
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to engage with stakeholders
You are naturally curious with the ability to manage tight deadlines


Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

Equal opportunity employer
NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.



Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.

For more information about this or other opportunities, please contact Dennis Anderson. Please quote our job reference number 571713.

About us

NTT Ltd. is a global ICT provider, employing more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace, and delivering services in over 200 countries and regions. We partner with organizations around the world to shape and achieve outcomes through intelligent technology solutions. For us, intelligent means data driven, connected, digital, and secure.

NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category. Cyber Security Engineer Level 3 - SOAR Engineer

At NTT we believe that by using innovative technology we can solve global challenges and create a world that is sustainable and secure. We are looking for curious people, from diverse backgrounds, that are keen to work in a fast-paced and agile environment.

At NTT we trust our employees to do the right thing, even when no one is watching, which is why we offer flexibility in the workplace. The majority of our roles are hybrid, meaning we encourage a balance of working from home and our local office. Ask our recruitment team if this is a hybrid role.

Want to be a part of our team?

NTT is looking for a Level 3 Cyber Security Engineer to join our managed services team on a permanent position.


This resource will be part of NTT's Cyber Security Incident Response (CSIR) team. The CSIR team is essential in providing an orchestrated and rapid security incident response capability with an oversight of security incident response across wider NTT Managed Security Services clients. The CSIR team utilise various security technologies to identify alerts, prioritize and investigate security issues in a fast-paced environment maintain the level of communication with internal and client stakeholders.

The Cyber Security SOAR Engineers vision is to deliver the security automation agenda across managed services security clients supported by NTT and continuously evolve the team and practice capabilities to align with new technology and services and help disrupt the way we deliver to our clients.

Working at NTT

What does your day look like within the team?

Create a link between development and operations by applying a software engineering mindset to system administration activities
Design, innovate and build large scale automations to provide efficiencies to NTT and our clients
Help drive a cultural movement of automation across the business and coach others who are learning a new way of working via code and automation
Automating infrastructure technologies with a modern approach aligned to things such as Infrastructure as Code, Configuration as Code, and DevOps
Participate in team planning activities and ensure progress is being made against the business objectives
Document automation processes and runbooks across staging, production, and technical administration tasks
Work closely with our operational engineering teams and provide consulting and troubleshooting to alleviate the pressures with operational and reliability issues
Work closely with technology subject matter experts and business analyst to understand requirements and automation use cases
Work with our technical management office (TMO) to participate in the technology standards lifecycle
Promote standardization and automation across infrastructure that we support and manage for our clients
Maintain existing automation infrastructure used to identify risks in areas such as performance, reliability, capability and scalability
Be responsible for deployment, maintenance, and enhancements of automation workflows (own your code)
Follow the change and release processes to prevent production outages and ensure engineers who operate the automation know how to operate it
Participate in post incident reviews and documenting findings and act on their learnings and enhancements of your code

What will make you a good fit for the role?

Mandatory requirements:

At least 3-5 years of experience in Automation technologies: (Palo Alto xSOAR, or other SOAR solutions, Ansible, Docker, Kubernetes)
Analytics technologies: (ElasticSearch, PowerBI, JSON)
At least 3-5 years of experience in Coding technologies: (Python, PowerShell, Source Code Management)
Atlassian technologies: (Jira, Confluence)
Proficiency in at least one programming language i.e. python
At least 8 - 12 years of experience in a technical support environment working with Firewall - Checkpoint, Palo Alto, Cisco, Juniper, Proxy - BlueCoat, Zscalerr and F5 security products.

Technology domain requirements:

Security technologies for example firewalls, antivirus, IPS, access controls
Cyber Security Operations SIEM solutions like (Splunk ES, Microsoft Sentinel).
Cloud technologies for example AWS, Azure, GCP
Data Centre technologies for example storage, and servers

Behavioural skills:

Passion for coding / scripting, automation and innovation
Positive attitude and willingness to learn
Ability to critically examine a system and use that to guide them when asking questions of the system
Maintaining good relationships with engineering teams
Big picture mindset and enjoy problem solving
Highly analytical with a level of business value and outcomes focused
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to engage with stakeholders
You are naturally curious with the ability to manage tight deadlines

companyName: NSW Department of Communities and Justice
listing_jobDesc:
Division: Corporate Services
Location:
Parramatta, NSW, AU, 2150
Req ID: 51492
Senior Security Architect

Employment type: Full-time, temporary 2 years (35 hours per week)
Location: Parramatta with flexible/remote options
Salary: $113,343 - $124,901 plus super and leave loading

Your role

The Senior Security Architect is responsible for ensuring security is appropriately considered in procurements and implemented within solution designs. The role monitors the organisation’s compliance with information security policies and procedures.

What you’ll do

Information and Digital Services, within the Corporate Services division, provides secure and modern IT services to support and enable DCJ staff to achieve positive outcomes for stronger communities.

This role is responsible for contributing and reviewing cloud hosting arrangements and all ICT solution designs including:

Ensuring security requirements are identified early through consultation;
Ensuring solution designs implement appropriate protective controls and processes which support and or develop compliance levels;
Designs comply with Information security policy and standards;
Contributing to the development of the cyber security strategy;
Participating in the operation of the Information Security Management System;
Developing and delivering reporting and compliance testing to quantify the effectiveness of protective controls;
Undertaking investigations and risk assessments to provide comprehensive, evidence-based advice and recommendations.
Identifying and addressing potential systemic issues and themes by analysing data collated to provide input into changes to relevant procedure and/or policy.
Don’t miss this opportunity to join a highly professional, agile, and personnel focussed team where your growth and personal development is supported and valued.

What we’re looking for

In addition to meeting the essential requirements, the successful candidate must demonstrate strong capabilities in:
Working collaboratively and efficiently with stakeholders enabling you to build and maintain strong working relationships. The applicant should be organised, poses effective communication skills and be able to deliver to expected timeframes
Multiple security domains (e.g. security and risk management, asset security, security engineering, communications and network security, identity and access management, security assessment and testing, security operations etc) and cloud platforms
Key industry standards as well as risk management in an enterprise environment.
Essential requirements of the role

 Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline and/or equivalent knowledge, skills and experience with demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development.
Relevant information security and/or risk certification (e.g. CISSP, CISA, SABSA, Cloud Security, ISO 27001, ISO 31000)
It is an essential requirement of the role that successful applicants are fully vaccinated and able to provide acceptable proof of vaccination status.

Download the role description.

We do work that really matters

Working for the Department of Communities and Justice (DCJ) provides lots of opportunities to make a real difference. We collaborate with other agencies and community partners, to improve lives and realise the potential of children, adults, families and communities. We're focused on breaking, rather than managing, disadvantage. It’s work that really matters.

Are you ready to join us?

Select apply and attach a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the requirements of the role as well as an up-to-date résumé (maximum 5 pages).

Applications close Thursday, 25th August 2022 at 11:59pm AEST.

Got a question?

If you’ve got a question about applying or require an adjustment in the recruitment process, please, call Lisa Smith on (02) 8688 0491 or by email: lisam.smith@justice.nsw.gov.au.

For more information about the role or what it’s like to work for DCJ, please contact the hiring manager Nabil Farooqi by email: nabil.farooqi@justice.nsw.gov.au.

Inclusion and Diversity lies at the heart of how we recruit

We continue to hire great people with a wide variety of skills, experience and backgrounds. This includes people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, women, people identifying as LGBTIQ+, culturally and linguistically diverse people, carers and other diversity groups.

To find out what DCJ are doing to build an inclusive and diverse workforce, visit our careers site.

Other Information

A Talent Pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 18 months.

Due to the Covid-19 Pandemic some interviews and assessments may be performed using alternative methods. For more information visit Our Process.

Relevant information security and/or risk certification (e.g. CISSP, CISA, SABSA, Cloud Security, ISO 27001, ISO 31000)
It is an essential requirement of the role that successful applicants are fully vaccinated and able to provide acceptable proof of vaccination status.

We do work that really matters

Working for the Department of Communities and Justice (DCJ) provides lots of opportunities to make a real difference. We collaborate with other agencies and community partners, to improve lives and realise the potential of children, adults, families and communities. We're focused on breaking, rather than managing, disadvantage. It’s work that really matters.

Are you ready to join us?

Select apply and attach a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the requirements of the role as well as an up-to-date résumé (maximum 5 pages).

Applications close Thursday, 25th August 2022 at 11:59pm AEST.

Got a question?

If you’ve got a question about applying or require an adjustment in the recruitment process, please, call Lisa Smith on (02) 8688 0491 or by email: lisam.smith@justice.nsw.gov.au.

For more information about the role or what it’s like to work for DCJ, please contact the hiring manager Nabil Farooqi by email: nabil.farooqi@justice.nsw.gov.au.

Inclusion and Diversity lies at the heart of how we recruit

We continue to hire great people with a wide variety of skills, experience and backgrounds. This includes people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, women, people identifying as LGBTIQ+, culturally and linguistically diverse people, carers and other diversity groups.

To find out what DCJ are doing to build an inclusive and diverse workforce, visit our careers site.

Other Information

A Talent Pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 18 months.

Due to the Covid-19 Pandemic some interviews and assessments may be performed using alternative methods. For more information visit Our Process.

Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application. Senior Security Architect

Employment type: Full-time, temporary 2 years (35 hours per week)
Location: Parramatta with flexible/remote options
Salary: $113,343 - $124,901 plus super and leave loading

Your role

The Senior Security Architect is responsible for ensuring security is appropriately considered in procurements and implemented within solution designs. The role monitors the organisation’s compliance with information security policies and procedures.

What you’ll do

Information and Digital Services, within the Corporate Services division, provides secure and modern IT services to support and enable DCJ staff to achieve positive outcomes for stronger communities.

This role is responsible for contributing and reviewing cloud hosting arrangements and all ICT solution designs including:

Ensuring security requirements are identified early through consultation;
Ensuring solution designs implement appropriate protective controls and processes which support and or develop compliance levels;
Designs comply with Information security policy and standards;
Contributing to the development of the cyber security strategy;
Participating in the operation of the Information Security Management System;
Developing and delivering reporting and compliance testing to quantify the effectiveness of protective controls;
Undertaking investigations and risk assessments to provide comprehensive, evidence-based advice and recommendations.
Identifying and addressing potential systemic issues and themes by analysing data collated to provide input into changes to relevant procedure and/or policy.
Don’t miss this opportunity to join a highly professional, agile, and personnel focussed team where your growth and personal development is supported and valued.

What we’re looking for

In addition to meeting the essential requirements, the successful candidate must demonstrate strong capabilities in:
Working collaboratively and efficiently with stakeholders enabling you to build and maintain strong working relationships. The applicant should be organised, poses effective communication skills and be able to deliver to expected timeframes
Multiple security domains (e.g. security and risk management, asset security, security engineering, communications and network security, identity and access management, security assessment and testing, security operations etc) and cloud platforms
Key industry standards as well as risk management in an enterprise environment.
Essential requirements of the role

 Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline and/or equivalent knowledge, skills and experience with demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development.
Relevant information security and/or risk certification (e.g. CISSP, CISA, SABSA, Cloud Security, ISO 27001, ISO 31000)
It is an essential requirement of the role that successful applicants are fully vaccinated and able to provide acceptable proof of vaccination status.

The School of Computing and Information Technology (SCIT) was established in 2015 with a commitment to excellence in research and teaching in digital technologies and ICT. The multidisciplinary research portfolio across the university is innovative, internationally visible and incorporates the latest ICT technology and trends.This opportunity is for a Lecturer, Cybersecurity, to provide development, coordination of subjects and research within the Bachelor of Computer Science (majoring in Cybersecurity), and the ability to provide an innovative teaching experience in Computer Science at both undergraduate and postgraduate levels.The position requires the successful candidate be research active and have a national reputation in Web Security and/or Cyber Security, and have high quality research skills in Cybersecurity and other relevant topics. The incumbent will have a PhD in the area of cybersecurity blockchain, cryptocurrency or a related area, and have a demonstrated ability to mentor and supervise high degree research students.As women are underrepresented in this area, women are strongly encouraged to apply for these positions.Applications will be prompted to respond to selection criteria within the online application. Are you:

Expert in intrusion detection systems, SEIM, Anti-Malware, email gateway, Azure security and data loss prevention?
Able to develop and apply effective cyber security standards, processes technology and solutions in a team environment?
Keen to contribute to a measurable uplift in cyber security for a major cultural organisation?

Australia's largest public museum organisation is seeking a Cyber Security Operations Analyst.

ABOUT MUSEUMS VICTORIA:
Museums Victoria cares for the State scientific and cultural collections, providing visitor access, activities and events at five distinct venues: Melbourne Museum, Immigration Museum, Scienceworks, IMAX Cinema and world heritage listed Royal Exhibition Building.
To learn more about Museums Victoria, please visit museumvictoria.com.au/about/

ABOUT THE POSITION:
The primary responsibility of the Cyber Security Operations Analyst is the configuration, tuning and operation of enterprise security management tools to detect and respond to cyber security related incidents proactively. In addition, this position will focus on delivering security detection, monitoring and prevention capabilities for both physical and virtual infrastructures as well as perform security related troubleshooting and management of ICT infrastructure.

Notable skills and experiences:

Implement the recommendations of a cyber security audit by working with colleagues to deploy and configure tools and contribute to the development of standards and processes to improve and maintain a cyber security posture for Museums Victoria.
Configure, tune, and operate enterprise security management tools to detect and respond to cyber security related incidents proactively.
Perform security related trouble shooting and management of ICT infrastructure, including networks, often in circumstances whereby trouble shooting decisions may have a significant impact on MV's ICT infrastructure.

The successful applicant will have:

Solid technical knowledge, experience and understanding of current security concepts, principles, and practices preferably in the Australian/Victorian government. Broad knowledge of technical concepts with a focus on security.
Strong hands-on experience and knowledge with intrusion detection systems, SEIM, Anti-Malware, email gateway, Azure security, data loss prevention, and related enterprise security management tools.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience in developing and applying effective cybersecurity standards, processes, technology, and solutions. Demonstrated ability to work flexibly, both proactively and reactively, to address security challenges and issues.

OTHER INFORMATION
This is a VPS5.1, full time position for two years. The salary on offer is $103,920 (base of grade)+ 10.5% superannuation.
HOW TO APPLY?
To view the position description, visit Careers - Museums Victoria; for more information about this position, please contact Sam Serhan on 03 9385 4285.
To apply, please send your Covering Letter, Resume, a statement addressing each of the Key Selection Criteria by visiting Careers - Museums Victoria

Your Role:
As our Cyber Security Specialist and under the stewardship of our Head of Cyber Security, you will be responsible for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity and availability of GBAU’s and client information assets. The team works closely with our clients ensuring that their cyber security requirements are built into solutions and applications. There will also be synergy with the regional and global security teams ensuring that corporate security goals are met.
You will add value to Gallagher Bassett across the following:
Leading/contributing to key projects which support internal and external stakeholders
Provide security advice and guidance during development stages and system lifecycle of solutions.
Execute incident management procedures including monitoring and managing all local security breaches and handling of security incidents, root cause analysis and impact, taking appropriate action to prevent recurrence wherever possible
Developing and continually improving security controls to ensure that systems and services remain protected and available for all business units.
Ensure standards and guidelines are continuously evolving to consider new and emerging cyber security risks, new technologies and regulatory requirements.
Ensure there is a focus on building and maintaining client relationships both individually and within your team environment.

We’re interested in hearing from people who possess:
5-7 solid years’ experience in Cyber Security
Exceptional security problem analysis and resolution skills expanding across a broad range of hardware and software technologies.
Knowledge of cyber security standards such as ISM, Essential 8, ISO27001, NIST..
Knowledge and principles of Cloud and Software as a Service solutions, Mobile Device Management technologies, PKI technologies, Email and Web filtering technologies, Web Application Security and Remote Access technologies.
Knowledge of Windows / Unix / Linux Systems.
Excellent analytical approach to problem solving. Solid social skills and the confidence to communicate with global and local technical teams.
You are highly organized, planning the workloads of others comes naturally to you. You’re analytical with the ability to interpret salient information to relay to any audience
We love professionals who insert positive energy into our business
Excellent verbal and written Communication
Strong Time management skills - Solutions focused

If you live our values and demonstrate the people capabilities, we can not only offer you great career opportunities, bit on a day to day you’ll experience the following:
Work from home capability
Opportunity for full-time permanent employment
Attractive remuneration packaging
Excellent Working Environment – friendly, flexible and supportive working environment which is built around great team support and rewarding opportunities
Exciting career – as our Company grows, so do the opportunities for our people
Opportunities for ongoing education and development
Service recognition awards
Employee assistance program for yourself and immediate family members
Staff referral incentive

Gallagher Bassett is Australia's largest Third-Party Administrator (TPA). Our focus is refreshingly simple: we manage insurance claims on behalf of insurers, brokers, government bodies and self-insured corporations.
Gallagher Bassett (GB) has six offices in Australia located in Northern Territory, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Melbourne and Sydney, and employing over 1000 staff.
GB values its employees and offers a friendly, comfortable working environment that facilitates a Work and Life Balance!

About Cognizant
Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the US, Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world.
The role:
Cognizant is seeking a Cyber Security professional to contribute to the execution of Cyber Security incident response and investigations spanning across all functions of the Corporate Security organization.
What does success look like?
Deep technical knowledge of forensics analysis of Windows and Linux systems (workstations and servers)?Cyber/digital forensic investigative experience?Incident response experience?Experience in Cyber Security operationsExperience in Windows desktop, server OS, Linux?Technology skills with?cyber?security/forensic?software (Encase [preferred], AccessData, etc.) preferred???????????Certification such as: GCFA, CISSP,?EnCE, GCFE, GCIH, CEH preferred

Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities.
